LATEST NEWS
We are funded - yeah - but still value your support.  We are giving a FREE ComicScene Summer Special Sampler Comic featuring kickstarters and indie comics from 2020 to everyone who has pledge for the HOC 2020 in print or above.  If we reach £11,000 we unlock the stretch goal of all four cover bubble gum cards.  Thanks for your support.

THE STORY
Launched in 2020 the History of Comics is a 100 issue partwork covering comics from 1930 to the present day.  The project is scheduled to end in 2030 with the definitive collection of comic history ever made. The fifth book, The History of Comics 2020, covers history in the making from the year 2020, featuring all your favourite comics from the US, UK and across the world. In each book we also take a closer look at the work of your top characters and creators.   The next three books include 1971, 1976 and 1991.  With each kickstarter we offer four books at one time to 'binge read'.
This kickstarter also offers you the opportunity to catch up and get the first four books in the series featuring 1984, 1977, 1950 and 1986, slipcases to keep them in plus a Comic Club membership card and number, access to the Comic Club online with 2000+ extra digital pages about comics and extra features on the History of Comics website that we couldn't fit into the books at www.comicscene.org
Each perfect bound book is A4, full colour, 60 pages with optional slipcase that holds four books. 
Expect articles to feature comics from the UK, US and worldwide including Action, Bullet, Krazy, Monster Fun, Roy of the Rovers, American Splendour, Fantagraphics, Superman v Spiderman, Adele Blanc-Sec, Airtight Garage, Captain Britain, Frank Bellamy, Storm, Countdown, Knockout, Look-In, Tammy, Hugo Pratt, Blackmark, Sandman Saga, Buyers Guide to Comic Fandom, Fosdyke Saga, Mister Miracle, Talia and Ra's Al Ghul, Blueberry, Snowbirds Don't Fly, Blast, Toxic, Zit, Deadpool, Egmont UK, Palookaville, Mandy & Judy, Wizard, Brussels Comic Route Project, The Hulk, Star Wars Dark Empire, Bone, Judge Armitage, Green Lantern, 30 Years of the Judge Dredd Megazine and a Year in the Life of Rebellion, Being a Comic Laureate, Colin Maxwell on secrets behind his first issue of Commando, The Department of Truth, Madi and Keanu on kickstarter and why crowdfunding is the new way to sell comics, Covid inspired comics from Tales From The Quarantine to Quarantine Comix and The Daleks

campaign.story:
Esme Eldritch is a Sorceress, London’s greatest. She uses her magic to be a hero, to fight the good fight, and to defend humanity from the world’s greatest evils… or does she?
The story begins as a mysterious figure collapses at her door in fear. The figure begs Occulus for her help, claiming that he is being chased by a terrifying hound larger than any dog he has ever seen, with eyes that burn like fire.
Will our hero be able to protect the weary traveler from the nightmarish hellhound that pursues him? Or will the monster prove too formidable of a foe? Will Occulus live up to her moniker as London’s greatest magician, or will her arcane power reveal that there is far more to this tale than even she may have expected?
Occulus #1 follows our protagonist, Esme Eldritch. The self-proclaimed master of mystery and sovereign of sorcery known as Occulus, who has been fighting monsters and evil forces for millennia. The first issue of the series focuses on how she became such an iconic name in the world of magic, and what sorts of threats hide in the darkness waiting to be unleashed.
 The action pact first issue deals with the character's origins, how she obtained her powers and how she uses them for good. But as time goes on, it becomes apparent that the stranger is not the man he says he is, but rather, a powerful warlock. But why the disguise? Why the decoy? Why Occulus? All these questions and more will be answered in the pages of Occulus #1.
Occulus is A 28-page comic book featuring a modern twist on one of storytelling’s most ancient genres, Magic. Our new Sci-Fi / Fantasy / Superhero comic series is set in the bustling heart of London. The Big Smoke has seen its fair share of heroes and villains, but on one fateful night, a storm tears its way through the city, unleashing a monster straight from the depths of hell.
We're thrilled to be offering art prints by three different artists for this campaign! So if you select our Art Print pledge level then you will be receiving all three of these amazing designs, or on our standard physical pledge level, you will get one of your choosing! 
Print A - Guillermo Villarreal
Print B - Domenico Pagano
Print C - Kevin Bouchard
Occulus is the second series in Broadcast Comic's 'Superhuman Universe', following on from Diamond #1 that launched on Kickstarter in 2020. 

While both series are set within the same universe, their stories run parallel, meaning that if you haven't had the chance to check out Diamond #1, you can still start right here with Occulus.

However - If we have piqued your interest, both Physical and Digital copies of Diamond #1 are available as pledge rewards, meaning you can get caught up in all of the superhuman madness that is rocking our fictional London. 
 Matthew Hardy makes his writing debut for Broadcast Comics with Occulus #1, but those familiar with the UK Indie Comics scene are sure to recognize him from his amazing work over at Mad Robot Comics.
Kieren Stevens returns to Broadcast Comics as the co-writer of Occulus #1, after a successful Kickstarter campaign for Diamond #1 in late 2020. 
Another new face to the Broadcast Comics team is Guillermo Villareal. This hugely talented artist has done an incredible job of bringing the world of Occulus to life, and we can't wait for you to see everything that he has been working on.  
Rob Jones also makes his return to Broadcast Comics reprising his role as Letterer Supreme. Those familiar with Rob's work will know how much impact his work adds to a story, and if you haven't seen him in action, then this book will blow your socks off! (Link to his work can be found here: Website)
We know that shipping is a very scary prospect when it comes to Independent Comic Books on Kickstarter, so I wanted to clarify how your books will arrive!

Comics will be placed in bags and boards before being put into C4/A4 Hard Backed Envelopes. For our previous campaign 'Diamond #1', books travelled as far as the US and Peru and arrived in excellent condition!

Guillermo is tearing through the art for the book - with half the script illustrated already we expect to easily hit our fulfillment date.

With this being our second project, I'm proud to say that we've learned a lot going into Occulus #1. In our previous project, I wasn't happy with how long it took to get the rewards to backers, so going into this project that will have a lot more focus and understanding.

campaign.story:
DORK EMPIRE INK publishes wall to wall action adventure comics! We've been described as '90's Image with better writing.' Our goal is FUN ENTERTAINMENT. It's in our motto: 'MAKING COMICS FUN AGAIN!' We have a shared universe spanning two distinct eras featuring the MODERN ERA with AGENT WILD and the 2308 FUTURE ERA with REAPER CORPS.  Now, we introduce our newest future era book...
  FULL COLOR. 24 PAGES. ONE-SHOT.
Cover (sans logs) Pencils by DON WALKER, Inks by LARRY WELCH and colors by BRYAN VALENZA.
 Dreadlock #0 virgin variant cover pencils by Don Walker 
We're almost there. So let's get creative. Our first stretch goal will be...


 The year is 2308. Dreadlock and his crew traverse an unforgiving desert landscape of  a war torn plant Earth. What's left of the nearly extinct human race resides in three Mega Cities, 'protected' by a race of sentient cyborg warriors known  as the Reaper Corps. A cyborg army that saved mankind from total annihilation at the hands of the alien Zartori Empire.
Society now consists on Humans, Cyborgs and Cloned humans who, like the Cyborgs were created by the artificial intelligent named FATHER, as soldiers in the inter galactic BORDER WAR with the Zartori. Now, 80 years into Mankind and Earths rebuild, the cyborg protectors have become more like human jailers leading thousands of humans to flee the mega cities to create their own, cyborg free, settlements out in what was later coined The New West.
Neither hero nor villain, Dreadlock lives by his own rules. Yearning to express his human individuality. Control his own destiny. Living free, in search of adventure! Heaven help anyone who gets in his way.

NOTE: REAPER CORPS #0 which is available in this KS campaign.
 DON WALKER : Creator / Writer / Penciler.  Instagram@don_spaceknight
JEFF GRAHAM: Inker PGS 11-20. Instagram@jeffgrahamart
SILAS DIXON: Inker PGS 1-10. Instagram@silasd
BRYAN VALENZA: Colorist. Instagram@bryan_valenza

Along with both digital and PDF version of the book, we have trading cards, and original art pages from the book as part of the campaign. Below is an example of just a piece of the $400 pledge level.

For the Dreadlock campaign the variant cover will feature YOU as a member of his crew as you and he fight clones. You'll receive the cover pencils, signed by creator/writer/artist Don Walker (among many other rewards). Check reward tiers for all rewards.
 AND ALSO INTRODUCING...
Concept art for Diamond Savage (pictured left) and her sister, Ruby Savage. Dreadlock #0 will be their first appearance with a scheduled, solo, issue #0 in 2022. Art by Don Walker.

updates.update_content:
OK, I've been M.I.A. from updates for a few weeks and I apologize. Here's the scoop:

For those of you who know me personally, you all know I have a number of medical problems, most importantly diabetes, Afib, hypertension etc. On top of all that I have degenerative disk disease (a crumbling vertebrae in my back) which is a source of chronic pain.

Hey gang,
Still plugging away and finishing pages. The added 6 pages have caused me to rethink where the story is going and so the original 20 pg story is being revamped to fit those new pages seamlessly. I don't want those pages to feel slapped on at the last minute.
I'll have new pages to show off next Thursday.

OK, I've recovered from the campaign!
GOING FORWARD!
I have commissions to get finished this week (it's how I make me money) so I wuill be getting back tp Dreadlock full timer next week. I'll be adding 6 pages (stretch goal #4) and that may push back our timeline a bit. I'm hoping to fini9she production in 6 weeks. Now, my creative team mates are all working comic professionals and while all are committed to Dreadlock, scheduling issues may occur. Should this happen, I'll let you all know asap.
PLEDGES!

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!!
We did it1 Thanks to all of you Dreadlock the Barbarian #9 will be joining the ranks of the Dork Empire Ink line of books. I've run a number of successful campaigns but you've all made this one the most successful. Most money raised. Most backers. Most stretch goals unlocked.

campaign.story:
Emulator #1 Cover
Calvin Jones plays a lot of video games. His dad, Victor, is a busy police officer on the New Kingsdale force.  Calvin’s mom died two years ago. Instead of talking about their pain, the two lose themselves in play and work. 

The latest release of Lionheart 3: Revenge of Doctor Maelstrom sees Calvin and his friends, Russ and Dan, skipping school to play. During a heated discussion about whose turn it is, something goes wrong and the villain, Doctor Maelstrom, blows out of the game and into Calvin’s basement. Now, they must find a way to return Maelstrom to the game world, but the game keeps crashing, and Victor is concerned about this new terror on the streets of Kingsdale.
- TV/Films like Stranger Things and The Goonies.
- Cartoons like Archie’s Weird Mysteries and Scooby Doo.
- Super Nintendo and PlayStation One classic games.
- Comics books like DIE, Champions, and Birthright. 
Page 001
Page 002
Page 003
Page 004
Page 005
Emulator #1 Variant Cover
"Emulator seems to pull right from my memories of racing my siblings home from the bus stop to get to the games first. Yanking the cord out of the console didn't set the game's big bad loose and only summoned an annoyed parent threatening to not replace any broken controllers, but the story and characters are hitting that happy warm gooey center of nostalgia. I'm eager to see where this adventure takes them."
- Jenn Lee (Rising Sand)
 Every book is printed at the highest quality on industry standard paper with thick matte covers. 
- Emulator #1: 20 pages of story printed at standard American comic book size.
- Emulator #1 Variant Cover: Kickstarter Exclusive, will be available only through this Kickstarter campaign. Illustrated and colored by Sachi Ediriweera.
- Transmute: 48 page anthology. Four stories illustrated by Alaire Racicot. Comes free with every physical order. 
- D&D One-Shot: Play a one-shot DMed by Toben. Session will be 3-4 hours played via Discord.
- Racicot Comic Grab Bag: A mystery swag bundle of comics Toben has lettered; includes single issues, anthologies, and trade paperbacks. Contains any combination of: Beastlands, Slightly Exaggerated, Sidekick for Hire, Sidequest, Fallen, Crown & Anchor, The Wild Cosmos, Story Snacks, Lionborn, IF Anthology, and Leaders of the Free World.
Emiliana Pinna - Emiliana began her comics journey in 2016 with a degree in Italian and American comics at Scuola Internazionale di Comics. She's worked as an ink assistant and finisher. She's worked with Daltonica and Green Moon Comics, as well as The Glimpse and a story for Acid Free Lab. She plays old video games and reads mystery stories. Her favourite game is Crash Bandicoot.  
Tankitha Joy - Tankitha is our colorist. She’s been working on her own things...to be published someday. She studied Illustration at Brigham Young University - Idaho and currently studies Comic and Sequential Art at Phoenix college. She grew up watching her many brothers play many video games like Zelda, 007, Mario, Spyro, and old Nintendo games, but played just a few herself. She spend her childhood days coloring, playing outside, and reading too many stories. 
Toben Racicot - Toben is a writer and letterer. He’s worked on a variety of indie comics like Beastlands, Sidequest, Gimmick, and the Bite of Brenna Barlow. He studies Role-Playing Games and Collaborative Worldbuilding at the University of Waterloo. He grew up playing Super Nintendo and losing his eyesight playing Game Boy by the light of passing streetlights. His favourite games are Fire Emblem, Donkey Kong Country 2, and Diablo 2. 
Emulator #1 is illustrated and lettered. Colours are progressing nicely.
TIMELINE
Receive Kickstarter Funds: April 31
Finishing art production: June
Book Printing: June
Expected delivery to Canada/US Backers: August
Expected delivery to International Backers: August
BUDGET
Printing: 95%
Fees: 5%
All art costs for #1 have been paid out of pocket. All surplus from this campaign goes towards Emulator #2 production.
SHIPPING
All comics will be individually bagged and boarded, and shipped in high density document mailers.

campaign.story:
The Plague and Doctor Caim is a 112-page full colour original graphic novel from acclaimed creator G.E. Gallas and is the latest project from new independent publisher Cast Iron Books.
The Plague and Doctor Caim Book and Ebook

This campaign is to fund production and distribution costs, to get this story printed and out into the world and as many hands as possible.
The Plague and Doctor Caim follows the life of a 17th-century plague doctor: an Everyman with a beak. 

Doctor Caim is hired by a village to treat both the rich and the poor. The doctor readily accepts the position, but goes about the work with much trial and error. 

Doctor Caim encounters patients from all walks of life, experimenting with treatments while monitoring his own health and watching the stars for omens...

Interior Pages
Research is the integral foundation of both the script and design of The Plague and Doctor Caim. Each medical treatment Doctor Caim tries and every situation Doctor Caim finds himself in is based on historical facts. 

With the aesthetic of a medieval illuminated manuscript, this graphic novel finds macabre comedy within the history of the bubonic plague.
The plague doctor has fascinated all sorts of people with his instantly recognisable costume and beak mask, but many are unfamiliar with the history behind them. The plague doctor appears in many supernatural-themed comics, is a favorite among numerous cosplayers, and can be found adorning many bodies as tattoos… but none of these glimpses of the sinister silhouette delves into the reality of the plague doctor’s life, as The Plague and Doctor Caim does.
The Plague and Doctor Caim Hardback Book
G. E. Gallas is a writer and illustrator best known for her graphic novel The Poet and the Flea about the poet-painter William Blake. After studying Japanese language  and culture for many years, she spent a year abroad in Tokyo, Japan. She graduated from New York University: Gallatin School of Individualized Study with a major involving cross-cultural storytelling. She has spoken upon invitation to The Blake Society (London), Yale University School of Drama, and Germanna College (Virginia). Gallas specializes in historical fiction with touches of the fantastical and macabre and is Founder & member of The Historical Comics Collective.

The Plague and Doctor Caim is the latest title from Cast Iron Books, a new independent publisher of graphic novels and illustrated books based in the UK. It was founded in the summer of 2020 by Lizzie Kaye, formerly of SelfMadeHero, Titan Comics and Unbound.
We believe in empowering writers and artists to create stories that stay with a reader long after the last page has been turned.
We want to keep things simple for you – the book is the main reward!
Every backer will also receive the Ebook edition and you can also receive a bookmark, bookplate, art print or postcard set... and a Limited Edition Doctor Caim Coin badge!
We want to give as many people as possible the opportunity to get on board with this project, in whatever way suits you, so please get in touch if you'd like to discuss combining reward levels!
And... our first Stretch Goal!

If we reach £5,000 ALL Kickstarter backers of the physcial edition will receive a Special Doctor Caim Mini Bookplate, in the style of a Lino Cut Print.
The perfect size to paste inside your copy of the book, with space for your name!

Our next Stretch Goal will be unlocked at £5,500 – stay tuned to see what it will be!

updates.update_userinfo: About the Time Period by G. E. Gallas
updates.update_content:
The Plague and Doctor Caim takes place sometime during the second half the 17th-century (also known as the 1600s). To better place this graphic novel in a historical context, I thought I’d give some examples of European milestones across the period:
The 1603 London plague epidemic killed 40,000 people.

updates.update_userinfo: About Plague Doctors by G. E. Gallas
updates.update_content:
The plague doctors of old were quite different than how we might suppose. Our collective imagination has imbued the plague doctor and his beak mask with ominous mystery and supernatural powers.
In my graphic novel, Doctor Caim embodies the reality of an average plague doctor during the 17th century. Each medical treatment Doctor Caim tries and every situation Doctor Caim finds himself in is based on historical facts.

Hello!

A momentous day for The Plague and Doctor Caim – we've hit 99% funded!

Potentially, our next backer could be the one to push this project to fully funded!

updates.update_userinfo: About the Design by G. E. Gallas
updates.update_content:
Comics are the balance between words and images. Since I began working on my graphic novel trilogy The Poet and the Flea, about the poet-painter William Blake (1757 – 1827), I have often thought of Blake’s illuminated manuscripts (his illustrated poems) as a precursor to today’s comics in their uniquely Blakean combination of word and image.
While working on The Plague and Doctor Caim, which takes place 100 years or so before Blake’s time, I hit upon a connection between Doctor Caim and the illuminated manuscripts that must have inspired Blake. Illuminated manuscripts date as far back as the year 400 up through the 1600s (and perhaps beyond, if we include Blake and other artists). The quintessential illuminated manuscript is a book from Europe during the Middle Ages handwritten in blackletter and painted with vibrant pigments by monks. These books were mostly Christian texts such as the bible or a book of hours.

campaign.story:
Down below the abandoned skyscrapers and crumbling colonial architecture, beneath the buzzing lights and ragged billboards, is a fading, floundering city propped up by vice, extortion, and fear. This is BLACKSTONE—a dark, mirror image of Boston or Philadelphia. A city whose history dates back to the earliest days of our nation.
Blackstone. A city in need of a hero!

 A once-mighty industrial titan—now teetering on the edge of oblivion. A city that used to mean something.

Blackstone public defender Jaime Nuñez -  former baseball hero, now a divorced dad to a precocious teen - is always trying to do his best.  But the criminal justice system is not without limits. When Jaime comes into an unexpected fortune and some surprising, super heroic tools, he discovers there might be another, more direct way to do some actual good in the world.

When a new hero appears, a flicker of hope cuts through the darkness.
But can the masked man known only as The Dusk push back against decades of entrenched corruption without compromising his commitment to social justice...

Much less his teenage daughter's?

spoiler alert: probably not!

Creation.Ink is proud to present our latest oversized 8x12 hardcover graphic novel, THE DUSK,  brought to you by the minds and talents of Alex Segura, Elizabeth Little and David Hahn, with Ellie Wright and Taylor Esposito.

(Read more about the creation of The Dusk HERE!, thanks to our friends at BOING BOING.) 

Has anyone ever seen The Dusk and Jaime Nuñez in the same room?

THE DUSK is a modern reimagining of the superhero vigilante that flips the script on the traditional “might makes right” approach while adding the grounded, socially conscious perspective that modern crime fiction has become known for. 

The graphic novel blends the dark deco of BATMAN: THE ANIMATED SERIES with a dose of moral complexity and dark humor, creating an engaging and witty look at the inner workings of a beloved genre through the eyes of a flawed, human, and heroic figure.

Aided by an all-star team of fan favorite creators: Howard Chaykin, Francesco Francavilla, Jamal Igle, Rebekah Isaacs, Gabriel Hardman and more, Jamie  Nuñez has begun to fight the never-ending battle for the heart and soul of Blackstone City. 


Pete Woods' stunning hardcover variant cover



But The Dusk will need your help to finish the war!


the legendary Howard Chaykin's variant Dusk cover
                              The Creative Team
The creative team behind the project draws on a wealth of professional experience and diverse personal backgrounds to create and enrich the characters and world of The Dusk. Together, they bring decades of storytelling experience in various formats to the project. 
 Alex Segura is an acclaimed, award-winning writer of novels, comic books, short stories, and podcasts. He is the author of Star Wars Poe Dameron: Free Fall, the Pete Fernandez Mystery series (including the Anthony Award-nominated crime novels Dangerous Ends, Blackout. and Miami Midnight), and the upcoming Secret Identity. His short story “Red Zone” won the 2020 Anthony Award for Best Short Story, and his border noir short story, “90 Miles” will be included in THE BEST AMERICAN MYSTERY AND SUSPENSE STORIES of 2020. He has also written a number of comic books, most notably the superhero noir The Black Ghost, the YA music series The Archies, and the “Archie Meets” collection of crossovers, featuring real-life cameos from the Ramones, B-52s, and more. He is also the co-creator/co-writer of the Lethal Lit crime/YA podcast from iHeart Radio, which was named one of the best podcasts of 2018 by The New York Times. By day he is Co-President of Archie Comics. A Miami native, Alex lives in New York with his wife and children.

Elizabeth Little ( elizabeth-little.com )  is the best-selling author of Dear Daughter, Pretty as a Picture, and two works of nonfiction. Her crime fiction has been nominated for the Barry,  Macavity, and CWA John Creasey Debut dagger awards, and she received the Strand Critics Award for Best First Novel. Her latest novel, Pretty as a Picture, was Barnes and Noble monthly pick and a Los Angeles Times and Publishers Weekly bestseller. Her writing has also appeared in the New York Times, McSweeney’s, and the Los Angeles Review of Books, among other publications. 

David Hahn ( davidhahnart.com) has professionally illustrated comic books for over 20 years, including issues of Spider-Man Loves Mary Jane,  Marvel Adventures: The Fantastic Four for Marvel Comics, and Batman ‘66/Wonderwoman ‘77, Fables, and Fringe for DC Comics, as well as The Batman Handbook, licensed for Quirk Books.

             David was nominated for both an Eisner Award and an Ignatz Award for his creator-owned comic series, Private Beach, published by Slave Labor Graphics.

Joseph Illidge ( josephillidge.com ) is the Executive Editor for Heavy Metal magazine. Previously, he served as an Editor on the Batman line of comics for DC Entertainment, Executive Editor for Valiant Entertainment, and Senior Editor for “Hair Love” producers Lion Forge on their superhero imprint, “Catalyst Prime.” Joseph’s first job in the comic book industry was at Milestone Media, Inc., the groundbreaking publisher of inclusive superhero stories and creators of the animated series “Static Shock”, and he was featured in the History Channel documentary “Superheroes Decoded."

Ellie Wright is a Comic Book Colorist from The Republic of Ireland. Ellie's background is in Art, she has studied Creative Media Design at Crawford College of Art and Design. Ellie has been a freelance Comic Book Colorist since 2016,  and has worked for global publishing companies including: Dynamite Entertainment, DC, Image, and POW Entertainment. Ellie is also the proud winner of ICN 2018 & 2019 ‘Best Published Colourist in Ireland’. Some of Ellie's titles include Elvira: Mistress of the Dark, Betty Page: Halloween Special / The Secret Diary / Unbound, Sherlock Holmes: The Vanishing Man, Batman: The Shadow, James Bond: Goldfinger and many more. Ellie's work can be found here: www.elliewrightartist.com

Taylor Esposito ( ghostglyphstudios.com ) is a comic book lettering professional, owner of Ghost Glyph Studios and teacher at the legendary Kubert School. A former staff letterer at DC and production artist at Marvel, he has lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws and Constantine; Interceptor, Heavy, Finger Guns (Vault Comics), Exorsisters, Jook Joint (Image), Babyteeth, Hot Lunch Special, Knock ‘em Dead (Aftershock), and No One Left to Fight (Dark Horse). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Caster, Backchannel) Dynamite (Elvira, Red Sonja and Vampirella meet Betty and Veronica, Green Hornet), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The experienced creative and production teams behind The Dusk and Creation.Ink have worked in the comic book and collectibles industries for more than 75 years collectively. The funds raised through this campaign will fund the production and printing of the graphic novel and rewards. We have scheduled a realistic production timetable of the book that will allow the creators to produce top notch work while also delivering the final product to our backers in a very reasonable amount of time.

Alex Segura, Sean HusVar, and everyone on the team understand the trust that it takes for you to back our work. We will do everything we can to complete and ship the project on time. However, several of our recent projects have run into unanticipated delays, specifically related to the Covid-19 pandemic, and we need to acknowledge that the pandemic continues to provide a degree of unpredictability in the day-to-day production of projects. In case of delay, we will always strive to be transparent and keep our backers updated throughout production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Citizens of Blackstone!

Have you missed us? We've missed you too! 

We hope all of you are doing well out there since The Dusk campaign ended. As our project progresses through the production pipeline (try saying that five times fast!), you can expect updates about once a month, maybe more frequently as The Dusk nears completion and we reach the fulfillment stage.

Citizens of Blackstone!

WE DID IT!! The campaign is in the books and we couldn't be more pleased. Thanks to all of you, The Dusk has become a reality. Thank you isn't a big enough word (two words, actually) to express our gratitude. So instead of trying, here's another pin up that will be colored and featured in the Hardcover edition.

updates.update_userinfo: A few words from The Dusk team...
updates.update_content:
Citizens of Blackstone!

Normally, we try to get these updates out to you earlier in the day but it's been a bit like herding cats to get the videos below from The Dusk team. They've been partying nonstop since The Dusk campaign hit its funding goal yesterday. No one has even seen Joe Illidge since he rented a speedboat for what he promised was just going to be a quick jaunt to the Mohegan Sun in Connecticut. If anyone sees Joe out on the Thames River, tell him we're a little worried, OK?

Citizens of Blackstone, we are FUNDED! 

Thank you very much for making this project possible! You'll be hearing more from the creative team behind The Dusk tomorrow but we wanted to spread the word and make sure everyone knows that we are officially a go!

Citizens of Blackstone! 

We've had a tremendous run over the last 24 hours and as these words are being typed, The Dusk finds itself perilously close to hitting its funding goal this morning. Not to put the cart too far ahead of the horse but thank you all so much for everything you guys have done to help us bring this project to life. In particular, we want to present the first-ever key to Blackstone City to the mysterious ELMI, who has supported this project in a way that has blown us all away. We're going to cook up something special just for you, Elmi, and while we're sorry it won't be that Apainting you were hoping for, we hope you'll understand our gratitude for your tremendous gesture.

Citizens of Blackstone! 

Are you guys ready for what should be a wild week? The Dusk is currently 92% funded with 71 hours left in the campaign. We're excited for these final few days and the exhilarating sprint to the finish line that's ahead, and glad you guys are our "ride or die" until the very end.

Citizens of Blackstone!

Some very cool new Dusk pin up art arrived at the Ominous offices today so, before we get into our regularly-scheduled update, don't mind if we flex a little! First up, a lovely piece of awesome by Vincente Federici!

updates.update_userinfo: And then there were six... days left!
updates.update_content:
Citizens Of Blackstone!

The clock continues to tick and with six days left before the curtain falls, The Dusk campaign currently sits at 86% funded! Thanks (and welcome) to all of our new backers and thanks also to those of you that upgraded or added on to your pledges to get us to this point.  None of this happens without you guys and we appreciate your support.

Citizens of Blackstone!

One full week left in The Dusk!  It feels like just yesterday that we nervously pushed the button to kick off this whole campaign and now we're down to seven days. Man, time flies when you're having fun, right?

campaign.story:
SEX AND VIOLENCE VOLUME 3
 Welcome to the 15th PaperFilms Kickstarter Campaign!  That's right, the creative team of Amanda Conner and Jimmy Palmiotti have launched and funded with extreme success 15 straight Kickstarter projects thanks to the wonderful support of their fans, they're back for more!
  THIS IS THE ACTUAL COVER!- minus the banner. 
THE PROJECT:
Sex and Violence Vol. 3 is a full color, soft cover- square bound- 64 page ADULT graphic novel about crime, lust, and redemption- split into four distinctively different short stories sharing similar themes by an array of different creators. This is a true anthology, so you do not need vol.1-2, because no stories are connected. Each issues is its own thing. 
We are super happy to feature work by these amazing writers and artists: 
 Amanda Conner,  Justin Gray,  John J Hill, Patrick Wedge, Jimmy Broxton,  Lee Ferguson, Challenging Studios,  Gilbert Hernandez,  Joe Linsner , Marco Perugini, Aleksandar Bozic Ske, Elsa Charretier, Sarah Frazetta, Jimmy Palmiotti , Frank Frazetta and more.
Excessive nudity and violence makes this an ADULTS ONLY title.
The original SEX & VIOLENCE: VOL. 1 campaign has gone through a first printing and moved through a second printing, while the VOL. 2 has gone through all standard printing for the first run!  Don't miss out on joining the hit anthology series!

This Kickstarter is here to raise the funds to not only put together the book and pay everyone involved, but to create an EXCLUSIVE Kickstarter book that is unique in a few ways.  We will be using Print-on-demand to create an exclusive limited edition of the book based on the amount of orders we receive and certain editions will be signed by the assigned creators in different pledge levels
No logo, no noise, pure FRANK FRAZETTA.
As past supporters know, Amanda delivers the goods each and every time. Not for children please. This cover will feature some naughty images.
STRETCH GOALS:
After an amazing start, here are the stretch goals for SEX & VIOLENCE: VOL. 3



PREVIEW:
Okay, a sneak peek at the  preview pages from the 4 stories in the Sex and Violence Volume 3 edition.  They are censored in places- but will not be in the actual book. 
PINUPS GALORE: 
 REWARD TIERS: 
Below are a visual reference of all our pledge levels which are further explained in the campaign Rewards section.  We have a combination of both digital and physical options for everyone.  Due to the increased price in shipping (especially to those overseas folks, SORRY), we have multiple options.  We take great care in packaging these books with extreme care!
ADDED TIERS:
FERGUSON SKETCH ART CARD TIER W/ GRAPHIC NOVEL
This tier contains an original 4" x 6" original pencil/ink drawing of a pre-done image (see campaign description for the 7 pre-drawn sketches) by Sex & Violence: VOL. 3 interior artist LEE FERGUSON. Lee drew up seven amazing pieces of original art for this campaign for backers to enjoy! We'll insert one of the seven original art pieces in your package along with a signed standard cover of the exclusive Sex and Violence FRANK FRAZETTA.  You could get one of these drawings (random) in your package:
FERGUSON SKETCH ART CARD TIER W/ GRAPHIC NOVEL - Random original art reward

 POST CAMPAIGN ADD ONS:
We are anticipating having some great Add On options for those backers.  We do stress, those tiers that contain limited covers for SEX & VIOLENCE: VOL. 3  will likely not be offered in the ADD ON option!  Please do not request this, only available via the Complete Set option.  You'll be able to request and sample some of the other amazing PaperFilms projects and products post-campaign!  If we do have extra SEX & VIOLENCE: VOL. 3 covers of all sorts, we will be able to provide that as ADD ON options on a first come, first serve basis!
After the campaign ends, we have teamed up with the kind people over at Crowd Ox to send you an extremely simple survey in order to collect the info we need to fulfill your rewards.
The invitation will be sent directly to the email address linked to your Kickstarter  account. Be sure to check your spam folder in case it was captured there!
What is Crowd Ox?
Crowd Ox gives you the opportunity to verify your reward, make your selections (i.e. choose a color, size, etc) as well as verify and validate your shipping address. On top of all that, you can also upgrade your pledge level or add additional items to your existing pledge!
You do not need to make a login and password in order to access your survey as you will receive an email with a unique link. If you want to go back to review your info, simply click on the link in your email again.

Stretch goals and other potential tiers will be added as the campaign progresses as product availability and support continues!  We value all our backers support and contributions.  Communication and continuous updates to all our backers is paramount to the success of our campaigns.  Past backers can attest to the product quality, professionalism and overall satisfaction of the PaperFilms campaign so we'd love to see everyone participate!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any creator owned and self funded project has their own risks, however, the PAPERFILMS team does all within their control to mitigate these items. We'll be using a local printer for our projects and work to provide the ultimate quality without sacrificing time to printing and delivery.

Shipping costs are the ultimate challenge with these campaigns. Due to the increased price in shipping (especially to those overseas folks, SORRY), we have multiple options. We take great care in packaging these books with extreme care!

campaign.story:
I Am Hexed: is a 4 part series full color, original comic written by me, Kirsten Thompson.
Thanks to the magic of our amazing Kickstarter Coven our Issue #3 campaign was an amazing success!
This Kickstarter Campaign is for Issue #4, the final issue of our story. The fourth issue's script is complete and with your help we can go full speed ahead to commission art production and make issue #4 a reality!
Thanks for checking out my Kickstarter and Joining the Movement!
WE ARE NOW UNLOCKING STRETCH GOALS!!! SCROLL TO THE BOTTOM TO SEE THE MAGICAL ADDITIONS! 
 I Am Hexed is a supernatural political thriller. There’s magic, mystery, personal drama, and an accidentally carnivorous plant.
Witches have been a part of the political fabric of Washington D.C. since it was founded. It’s only since the 1960s that witches stood together and fought to take back the word “Hexed”. A movement was ignited when witches came out of the shadows and proudly showed off their broomsticks.
The witch-hunt for Charlie, Jaya and Florence continues as they find themselves on the run from malevolent forces both inside and outside the government. The three witches must harness their powers to defend themselves, while unraveling a mystery that could save the entire witching community.

Kirsten Thompson is a comic writer and editor based in the Pacific Northwest. In addition to being the creator and writer of I AM HEXED, she has been a consultant on such comics as Kim & Kim volume 2, a staff writer at The MNT and her writing has also appeared in Teen Vogue, Femsplain and Women Write About Comics.
Amagoia Agirre is a freelance illustrator and comic artist based in Spain. She is currently working on various projects including illustrated books, tabletop rpgs, and short comics. If she is not locked up in her studio drawing you’ll probably find her walking in the woods accompanied by her dog Iggy.
Paulina Ganucheau is a comic artist and illustrator based wherever her computer lives. She is the creator of Lemon Bird with an original GN out in 2022 and co-creator of Zodiac Starforce published by Dark Horse Comics. Her hobbies include watching pro-wrestling, cloud photography, and following cats on Instagram.
Jenn St-Onge is the bog witch/comic artist behind Dynamite’s NANCY DREW & THE PALACE OF WISDOM, IDW’s JEM & THE MISFITS, and Harper Collins' upcoming THE OJJA-WOJJA, along with a selection of cover work for companies such as Archie Comics, BOOM! Studios, Valiant Entertainment, Oni Press and more. Queer spoonie residing in a state of perennial spookiness (but who can be found corporeally manifesting around Ottawa, Canada most days)
Taylor Esposito is a comic book lettering professional, owner of Ghost Glyph Studios and teacher at the legendary Kubert School. A former staff letterer at DC and production artist at Marvel, he has lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws and Constantine; Interceptor, Heavy, Finger Guns (Vault Comics), Exorsisters, Jook Joint (Image), Babyteeth, Hot Lunch Special, Knock ‘em Dead (Aftershock), and No One Left to Fight (Dark Horse). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Caster, Backchannel) Dynamite (Elvira, Red Sonja and Vampirella meet Betty and Veronica, Green Hornet), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).
Bex Glendining is a biracial, queer, UK based illustrator and comic artist who loves drawing modern monsters and slice of life. When not working, they can usually be found building gundams, playing video games with friends or buying new plants.
Yoshi Yoshitani has always been inspired by cultures, histories, mythologies, and patterns from around the world. She uses this inspiration to fuel her concepts and illustrations.
Alane Grace is a Filipino-American Illustrator & Design artist living in Pasadena, CA. In recent years, she has credited work as a background painter for Crunchyroll's Onyx Equinox and Hulu's Solar Opposites. She loves to draw a certain winter spirit and a fairy queen.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The production and project management of this title is “in-house” and comfortably in my control, eliminating many variables that could cause delays. That being said, some of the things that rely on external production (The manufacture of rewards, logistics of packing & shipping individual rewards) may cause some delays. 

Depending on the print quantity, we may choose to print our books in Canada or overseas. If so, there could be problems such as our books being held in customs, and longer shipping times. 

I have spent the past eight months planning and refining this project. I have accounted for these potential problems and worked them into our schedule. 

Everyone will be updated every step of the way, throughout the entire production process. Of course, we will notify you of any setbacks that may arise. 

Thank you for casting your bit of magic on I Am Hexed!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
THE STORY
There have been four previous suns over four previous earths...each one born of the gods' sacrifice and each destroyed by the gods' conflicts.
When the gods came together to create the Fifth Sun, the Soul Guide of the Dead, Xolotl, refused to perform his own sacrificial rite. Jaded after millenia of destruction and death, Xolotl hid away and watched his family sacrifice themselves in the name of hope for life beyond themselves.
Xolotl, alone and ashamed, became racked with guilt, causing him to weep so intensely that his eyes fell from his head and descended to the center of the newly forged universe: the Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan.
Seeing an opportunity to redeem himself, to honor the sacrifice of his family, Xolotl guided the Aztecs to forge two macahuitl, imbued with a piece of his own godhood. The Left and Right Eye of Xolotl, entrusted to twin siblings to wield together in defense of the Fifth Sun, became known as...The Twin Blades.
Art by Julio Suarez and Rocco Langg, logo by Andrea Rosales
Now in the year 2108, the blades are entrusted to twins Xiomara and Basilio Gutierrez who inherited them as children. Xiomara is strong willed, determined, and believes in herself. She's committed to her role as wielder and her sworn purpose of defending the Fifth Sun...but Basilio? Well, there isn't exactly a bunch of threats to the Sun running around and he's ready to move on with his life. Leaving his role as Wielder behind to pursue his goal of becoming a teacher, Basilio strains his relationship with his sister. 

Unfortunately, things are rarely so simple. The Lord of the North himself TEZCATLIPOCA sees a distracted pantheon and a set of divided Wielders as an opportunity to mobilize his pawn YAOTL: a resurrected traitorous Jaguar Warrior now obsessed with never returning to Mictlān, the land of the dead. Yaotl is bestowed with a blade forged from the primordial Black itself and sets out to destroy the Fifth Sun and create a new universe for Lord Tezcatlipoca.

Can Xiomara and Basilio stop arguing long enough to stop Tezcatlipoca's champion? Even if they can...will it be enough?

THE TEAM
The Twin Blades is a latine story and is proudly produced by an entirely latine team of creators:
Written by Jarred Luján: Jarred is a Mexican-American comic writer from the promised land of Texas. A 2019 Mad Cave Studios winner, he broke onto the comics scene with the four-issue mini-series Dry Foot. He likes the Wu-Tang Clan and existentialism. 

Art by Julio Suarez: Julio Suarez is a Mexican illustrator, having worked his whole life towards becoming a comic book artist, his passion for drawing has allowed him to work for companies such as Upperdeck Ent. and Cryptozoic Ent. as a sketch card artist, working with licenses such as Marvel and DC Comics, as well as freelance illustration work the last couple of years, now making his debut in the comic industry with “The Twin Blades” as an artist, he is ready to show the world what he can do!

Colors by Rocco Langg: Based in Mexico City, she has worked on several comics ranging from commercial work for Mexican companies to her interactive IG comic Goodbye and Fuck You! She has a passion for sci fi and vibrant colors.

Letters by Gabriela Downie: From California, Gabriela has been in the comic industry for 7 years. She's done a little bit of everything including production art, cover art, and lettering. Her work includes Harleen, Beast Boy Loves Raven, Punchline, and Batman '89.

THE SWORDS
The LEFT EYE of XOLOTL, wielded by main character XIOMARA
The RIGHT EYE of XOLOTL - Wielded by main character Basilio
The blades of THE TWIN BLADES
THE PREVIEW PAGES 
THE PRONUNCIATIONS
While you wait for THE TWIN BLADES to hit your eyeballs, learn to pronounce some of the more intimidating words for English speakers:
Xolotl
Tezcatlipoca
Macuahuitl
Xiomara

updates.update_content:
Hey, folks.
Just a quick progress update. As previously noted, all the inked pages are completed. Rocco has just entered the home stretch for colors, I believe we are on track to have those finished next week, if not shortly after. Gabriela is lettering the rest of the pages.
All in all, I expect to be fulfilling the digital copy this month with physicals delaying until July. Like I said, the book will likely be done by the end of this month, July will just be waiting for it to get back from the printer. Fun stuff!

Hey, folks!
Just dropping in to let all of you know that last night Julio completed inks for THE TWIN BLADES. We are moving forward this week with getting the pages letter and the last dozen or so pages colored. Really exciting to see all the pages done in their inked glory. Alejandra, as I say every update, is killing it with colors. We're so close to getting this book in your hands!

Hey, folks!
Long time no see. I know I promised to not blow anyone's email up until we had some real news to share, but there was some concern about the lack of updates, so I wanted to hop in and give you a real quick peek behind the curtain.
We hit a production snag, but Julio has currently caught up and has only four pages left to pencil/ink. Pretty straightforward stuff, at his current pace I expect pages to be done within the next few days.

Hey, folks!
Just one last check in of the campaign. On the production side of things, Gabriela has just turned in 30 pages worth of letters, we're almost halfway through with colors, and I think we're down to just 9 pages worth of inks. If all goes well, the next three updates will be the completion of the book, the book heading to print, and the survey announcement. 
Thank you all again for your support on this. This campaign has hit almost every single goal I wanted it to. It's been stressful, it's been intense, but it's mostly been fun as hell. I'm psyched for y'all to get your hands on this book.

Hey, folks!
We are in the FINAL WEEK of our Kickstarter. That...is very cool. I'm proud of a lot from this Kickstarter, but we'll go into details about that stuff after this week concludes. So, the most you need to glean from this is that we still have about $3k until we get all those extra stories, so if you have anyone you know would dig this, the time is NOW to tell them to back it. They are running out of time, folks!

Hey, folks. 
Just a check-in as we close in on our final two weeks. We currently stand at 246 backers! We're still a ways away from our big stretch goal at $7500, but I'm still feeling pretty good all thing's considered. If we hit 250 backers by NCBD. I'm sure at least one of us have four friends who haven't backed (...right?) so let's get them in here if we can.
With that said, just a few small things. For those of you who have asked about restocking the tiers, it is not looking super great, so if you are wanting to get ahold of the trade without much of a wait, my advice would be to get it from your local comic shop or order it from . If you were wanting it signed, you may have to wait until my second Kickstarter later this year, which brings me to...

Hey, all!
I'm a little late from my last update, and I apologize for that, I wanted to kind of turn down the noise on our campaign for a moment so that a few projects I'm really into were able to get more of spotlight on them.
With that said, we're back in it. We have officially made it through our first week, we've got three left to go, so now we turn our sights to STRETCH GOALS. There is only one, but it's a doozy. The short explanation is that, because of you, I am able to give Mexicans swords, but why should I be the only one having fun doing that? So, introducing...

campaign.story:
They Call Her...The Dancer is a story that focuses on the beauty and brutality of dance and martial arts, delving into the morally gray psyche of a professional dancer and assassin.

At first glance, They Call Her…The Dancer is about analyzing the similarities and differences between dance and martial arts. Dance is something that is seen as beautiful, but many don’t think about the pain that is done to one’s body to truly be a dancer. Martial arts are thought of as violent because it’s a form of “fighting”, but there’s also a dance like quality to this work of art.
But once you dig deeper, the reader will quickly realize that The Dancer is actually a story about mental health. Mia is forced to face her own childhood trauma of witnessing her parents’ murder when she becomes the enemy that she once dedicated her life to fight against. The Dancer is a morally gray story that shows that good and evil aren’t so black and white.
With They Call Her...The Dancer #1, you get...
A 22-page, stapled, standard sized comic book printed by Comic Impressions,
including a Black & White edition
and FOR THE FIRST TIME also in COLOR! 
 5 Covers to choose from, including a limited Kickstarter Exclusive FOIL cover!
 Here's what comic book critics and pros are saying about THE DANCER:
Kat at comic conventions way back when those were a thing...
They Call Her...The Dancer #1 COVER A
Cover B - Perfect Blue Homage - Saw Nai Mon
When brainstorming variants for The Dancer, I knew I wanted something to showcase the shattering of 2 identities. Mia can’t be a fully formed person because she still has one foot in the past. The anime film Perfect Blue goes through similar themes of identity, and its movie poster was a perfect homage for our premiere issue.
Saw Nai Mon is an Animator/Illustrator and has graduated from LASALLE College of the Arts (Singapore) with a Diploma in Animation. He is currently working as a Character Concept Artist for both comic and animated film. As an artist, Saw enjoys illustrating outdoor backgrounds as it gives him an ideal visual of stories and characters that he would love to further develop.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've attempted to manage all of the risks associated with this project by doing most of the leg work before this campaign's launch so that we could ensure that we continue to deliver immediately after the campaign. As we did with our previous Kickstarters we will consistently update backers and supporters with any issues that may potentially cause delays in the completion of this project and make the necessary adjustments to resolve those matters quickly and efficiently. We understand the importance of fulfilling our promises and always ensure that all of our supporters receive their rewards. And we always find ways to sneak extra swag into our reward packages as a thank you for the patience in supporting our projects on the front end and patiently waiting for them to be completed and delivered....so we can focus on the fun part.....making comics!!! It's because of your continued support that we are able to make these AWESOME comics! And for that we truly appreciate ALL of our backers and keep a wide open form of communication for you all to reach us at any time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Everything is done for this comic book! I just need to send it to the printer.
Hazel, a pre-teen girl living in suburbia, is having a typical, boring evening when she’s startled by the premonition of a dragon awakening from a centuries long nap
As surprised as she is by the vision, she’s absolutely shocked when her cat, Mooney, opens his mouth and tells her that he too had the same premonition.
Mooney knows of only one man brave and mighty enough to go toe to toe with
 a dragon, the mighty warrior, Beowulf. Unfortunately, he's been reincarnated as this guy...
Victor's an unemployed millennial slacker who can't even get his life together much less slay a dragon.
Can Mooney and Hazel prepare Victor for the battle of a lifetime?
Beowulf is an epic tale that spans centuries, with heroes and villains fighting across time itself. Characters who are heroes in one lifetime may end up villains over the centuries. Lovers in one lifetime may become sworn enemies in the next.
If this all sounds overwhelming. Don’t worry — there’s also a lot of humor.
Sample pages below. All art by Antonio Brandao, Grant Lankard, and Roy Moon:
Not only is issue #1 completely done, issue #2 is over half done. The first 6 issue arc is already written so this is not a one and done situation. As long as this issue is funded, you don't have to worry about the story being left unfinished!
Once we reach the goal of $1500 the book will be funded! Everything after that will be used towards the next book in the series to improve the overall quality of the book and bring in more cover artists.
Positive reviews:

Dempsey Blackmore
X-Men Speculation
Big Glasgow Comic Page

Lastly, shooting the video with Mooney was not the easiest. Don't worry, he got lots of treats. Below is a blooper reel.

If you buy Russell's book Xenonanite Titan (click here) and Beowulf #1, you'll get a free window cling that features the dragons of both stories. This'll totally spruce up your car window way more than any stupid "baby on board" sign. 
Note: This promotion is for physical backers only. We can't pay extra shipping to send these window clings out unless you're already buying a physical copy of the book and comic book. Sorry digital customers!

campaign.story:
WELCOME TO...
Official Cover by Crystal Pandita
What if hunting became the biggest sport and television event in the world? In a world where most animals have been hunted to extinction, technology now allows people to create whatever monster they want for their bloody entertainment. Hunters from all over the world rise to the challenge to earn a spot in the world finals of The Preserve! For the former champion, Winston Abara, and his artist, Rachel Lin, their journey to victory will for more than glory and riches, but the chance to save their home. Yet the primal allure of the game is powerful, and despite going against Winston's belief in the natural order of life, will he succumb to the evil influence of...The Preserve."
Character Designs by Taylor Keith
The Preserve is a 5 Issue mini-series, starting with this first one being 28 pages. Set in the not so distant future, where the largest sporting event in the world has become The Preserve, a live game where hunters enter a prepared terrain to hunt a creature designed by the “Artist” of the other team, which then gets brought to life and released into the stadium. The game is controlled by the biggest corporation on the planet, Packard Industries, whose CEO runs the game. Our heroes (Winston and Rachel) enter the game to win the world finals and save their home from becoming the next Preserve! 
The story explores the gentrification of these major sporting events, as well as the sanctity of life while criticizing hunting as a sport and the disrespect society has for animals. Tone-wise, this is like Running Man meets the Hunger Games in a sports movie with the feel of Jurassic Park. Those who love those movies, as well as science-fiction, action, and deep characters fighting for what's right will enjoy this comic!
Page 1 (Art & Lettering by Taylor Keith, Coloring by Crystal Pandita)
Page 2 (Art & Lettering by Taylor Keith, Coloring by Crystal Pandita)
Page 3 (Art & Lettering by Taylor Keith, Coloring by Crystal Pandita)
Page 4 (Art & Lettering by Taylor Keith, Coloring by Crystal Pandita)
Page 5 (Art & Lettering by Taylor Keith, Coloring by Crystal Pandita)
Page 6 (Art & Lettering by Taylor Keith, Coloring by Crystal Pandita)
L.A. Chavez is the writer of The Preserve! His first project was Frontier-0, a self-funded space opera comic with an animated pilot! Then recently, he funded the first issue of his fantasy comic, Santa Fae, right here on Kickstarter! Now he's looking to expand into new territory with a more grounded sci-fi story, which became this comic.  When not writing, he enjoys reading, cooking, and talking with his friends online. Check out his work at:  www.wickedsuitproductions.com
Taylor Keith is the amazing artist bringing this comic to life! Based in North Carolina, US, she is an illustrator and comic artist with a passion for sci-fi, fantasy, and all things horror. 
Crystal Pandita is the colorist and cover artist for The Preserve! Hailing from Jakarta, she began her artistic career 2 years ago, honing her craft and working on comics like String, which you can find on Tapas. She loves horror and has a fondness for sci-fi technology.
Lettersquids is a letterer and graphic designer who has worked on several amazing indie comics, including projects with Scout, Action Lab, Advent Comics, Insight Comics, and many others. His comic Antares Finest (with art by ErrorBound) won the titles of "Best Comic" and "Best Lettering" on r/comicbookcollabs' 2019 Untold Worlds Anthology. He's jumping in as the official letter for The Preserve and doing the entire comic with his unique skills!
Swamp Monster Design
This whole endeavor is so that we can fund the rest of the comic, we keep none for ourselves.  All our costs go into the project, to the artist, colorist, and letterer, as well the printer and the shipping costs, so we need your help to help us finish it and see it become a reality! ^^
By just pledging $6, you can get the digital PDF of the entire first issue of The Preserve! And for $12, you can hold the physical copy in your hands! However you choose to read this story, we know you'll enjoy it! It's 28 pages of top-quality work by the amazing team of artists we've assembled to tell this tale, rooted in our main characters coming together. I really like to think of it as a slice-of-life sports movie that meets a John Wick-style horror story about monsters! ^^ 
Alternate Version of Cover
And for $20, on top of those, you'll also get the 36-page digital PDF of the first issue of my previous comic, SANTA FAE (complete with bonus short)! A fantasy crime drama about two elves knights looking to solve the murder that could shake the entire city of Santa Fae to its core! I like to describe it as Batman meets Lord Of The Rings, and if you're a fan of either (or both), you will LOVE this comic! ^^
Santa Fae # 1 Cover by Kal Huset
And for those of you who like to collect really cool art pieces, we offer one of the two awesome exclusive posters for The Preserve for those who pick the $30 tier! Each done by a different and talented artist, showcasing our two protagonists in their element. Winston Abara (The Hunter) by Ahmed Raafat and Rachel Lin (The Artist) by Lindsy Silva.
Winston (The Hunter) Exclusive Print by Ahmed Raafat
Rachel (Artist) Exclusive Print by Lindsy Silva
And finally, for those who are generous enough to donate $50 or more, we will give you a special producer credit and put your name at the end of the comic for your contribution. And for those who pledge $100, our amazing artist will draw you a special monster commission of your choosing designed to your specifications like the official ones you see below, which you can name! We'll make a special offer to the first 5 who pledge, to include their monster somewhere in the comic itself if they want!
NOTE: All our shipping rewards are limited to the U.S., Canada, and the U.K, but if you are from somewhere else in the world and are interested, message us directly and we could work around it.
Monster Designs by Taylor Keith
Monster Design by Taylor Keith
As much as we'd be happy with simply reaching our goal, if you guys want to see more content from us, then if we can cross the goal by an extra 600$ over the amount we set, we'll make a short bonus comic expanding on the world of The Preserve and my favorite supporting character, Contessa Francesca "La Benelli" Urbina! A badass hunter from Italian nobility looking to prove herself on the world stage of The Preserve!  It will be drawn by the amazing artist Jenny Odio, and I'd love to be able to include this short at the end of Issue 1! And if we go beyond 5K, we'll figure new extended goal to add during the campaign for you guys! 
Contessa Francesca "La Benelli" Urbina designed Taylor Keith

campaign.story:
Follow the continuing exploits of the Next Generation of Great Detectives. See the new stretch goals in the Rewards section below!
London, 1914 - Major Sheffield Holmes, nephew to the great detective, and his mysterious American partner Capt. Imogen Watson have uncovered a secret society known as "The Moriarty," a dark cabal that has vowed revenge on the Holmes family. Joined by the gruff Det. Inspector Agamemmnon J. Brick of Scotland Yard and the resourceful mechanic Juliette McKinnon, the new Holmes and Watson must defeat the zealot known only as "The Scholar" and prevent Europe from descending into war!
MAJOR HOLMES & CAPTAIN WATSON #3-4 picks up right where we left off and completes the first arc of the series, known as "The Adventure of the Vengeful Scholar." Having discovered the existence of the villainous cabal known as "The Moriarty," fanatical followers of the long-dead Napolean of Crime, the new Holmes and Watson must rely on their friends and their skills to uncover their nefarious plan and rescue someone very important to Sheffield Holmes.  But will the dark secrets in each of their pasts unravel the nascent 6th Special Intelligence Service? Issue 3 is a 24-page thriller that continues the tale, and the jam-packed 36 page Issue #4 brings the shocking conclusion to life. That's 60 pages of comics, what a deal!

Major Holmes & Captain Watson is a true labor of love for me, as a writer. I've wanted to tell this story since I was 9 years old when my Grandmother gave me a copy of The Complete Sherlock Holmes. I fell in love with the Great Detective then, and have reread his adventures over and over.  When (most of) the Holmes canon became public domain, I decided I wanted to put a new twist on the old tales, to create a new Holmes and Watson that shook up old ideas. Sheffield Holmes and Imogen Watson are equals, more than anything else, real partners and friends who rely on each other. They are both great detectives and skilled spies as well, and England will soon need them. They also each old dark secrets about themselves...
Check out a preview of Issue #3 below. 
“I could tell from the first page of the preview art that I'd be into this… take(s) well-worn characters and remix(es) them in surprising ways” - SYFY Wire.

"Stepping out from the shadow of giants is hard, but Jeff and Ismael have done a tremendous job in doing just that. A story that feels Sherlockian, but steps onto its own path with its own characters in its own story" - Jarred Luján, writer - DRY FOOT (Mad Cave Comics)

Jeff Rider - is a writer living in Orlando who publishes his comics in print and digitally at CloudwranglerComics.com and on ComiXology. Jeff has been telling stories since he could talk and loves collaborative art in all its forms. In addition to Major Holmes & Captain Watson he’s the writer of the urban fantasy series The Arcane Cocktail Enthusiast with artist Davide Puppo (successfully funded via Kickstarter), the sci-fi adventure Gravity Matters with Sean Dillon (also a successful Kickstarter), and many more comics to be collected in an anthology of shorts coming this year.
Ismael Canales - Ismael has worked with independent publishers both from the USA and Spain (ECV Press, Diabolo Ediciones, NowEvolution, Marauder Film), mainly in comic book anthologies with short stories. He started collaborating with Butxido Agency, and since then he has worked in the comics Athena Voltaire (ActionLab) and The Catch (Kickstarter) and is also currently working on a graphic novel for Dolmen Editorial (Spain). He lives in his hometown with his lovely girlfriend and their little (and evil) bunny, Guantes.
Roger Sorruca - Roger Sorruca is an Illustrator, digital artist, and comics colorist living and working in Barcelona, Spain. In addition to Major Holmes & Captain Watson, he is the colorist for Athena Voltaire (Action Lab.)
Justin Birch - Justin Birch is a  2018 Ringo Award-nominated letterer born and raised in the hills of West Virginia. Lettering comics since 2015, he is a member of the lettering studio AndWorld Design and has worked with DC, IDW, Dynamite, Lion Forge Comics, Mad Cave Studios, Action Lab Comics, DMC Comics, Source Point Press, Z2 Comics, and numerous indy publishers. Justin still lives in West Virginia, only now it’s with his loving wife, daughter, and their dog, Kirby.
Everyone knows that comics don't get made cheaply. When I created these books, I wanted to make sure that the artists got paid for their work upfront, and at a fair market rate. The majority of the money raised during this campaign goes to cover those artistic costs, cash that goes straight to Ismael, Roger, and Justin plus all the talented artists making art for Alt-Covers and stretch goals. They're the folks who made this story so awesome to read and look at. The rest are costs associated with the physical production of the books and other rewards like packaging, prints, etc. As the creator of Major Holmes & Captain Watson,  I don't take a page rate for myself on these books. Rather, as with every other campaign, any money raised beyond our goal goes to fund future issues of Major Holmes & Captain Watson! Rest assured, while these books are the end of this story arc, this is only the beginning of their adventures.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
So far the risk and challenges to Major Holmes & Captain Watson #'s 3-4 are very few. As you can see from the timeline above, the books are already very nearly complete. Coloring and lettering of issue #4, back matter creation, and layout are the only things left to complete before the books go to the printer. Some additional digital and comics perks like prints, custom packaging, and stretch goal rewards will be the only items to be created after the project ends, due to needing to know the total number of backers and so forth.

These orders will come while we're still in the throes of the COVID-19 pandemic, but we're working with a printer we trust, and they assure us delays are unlikely. This is our second time with this particular printer and they were great back in Nov 2020, so we expect more of the same.

This is also my fifth Kickstarter and the second for the Major Holmes series and is similar in scope to our previous projects. Those projects funded quickly, and all digital and physical rewards were shipped within the promised deadlines, less than three months after the end of the campaign. I've learned the value of making sure that the comic is almost entirely complete before launching a campaign means a really quick turnaround time and rapid rewards delivery. The few hiccups from our earlier endeavors became teachable moments for this one, so I expect even more smooth sailing. As always, should the unexpected happen, we'll keep everyone updated.

updates.update_content: Hey everyone, I need to keep you all up to date on the developments with Major Holmes & Captain Watson #3-4.  So far things are going very well, but sadly they aren't going as quickly as we planned. It looks now like the final art won't get sent to the printers until the beginning of July, and this will delay shipping until late July. But rest assured, we're working as fast as humanly possible, and more importantly we're making some beautiful books, which is really the better goal, right? Just to prove how beautiful... here's a tease of issue #4!

Hey everyone! I just wanted to reach out to let everyone know what's happening. Major Holmes & Captain Watson rewards are rolling into my office from our suppliers, and work continues apace on issue #4. We're not expecting any changes to the current timeline of late June shipping, but as always we'll keep you posted. In the meantime, if you still want one or two spare 6th Special Intelligence Service Officer's Field Notebooks, handy for writing down important clues or coordinates (or just doodles) we have plenty! Add them, or any other awesome stuff you missed out on, to your rewards package here!

updates.update_userinfo: Add-On Store re-opened! Plus a shipping update
updates.update_content:
Thank you all one more time!
OK, I'll stop gushing, but we're just so excited that so many folks are interested in this book. We couldn't be prouder of it, and can't wait to get it to you. In the meantime, we've opened up our post-campaign Add-On Store for backers only! While Kickstarter does now have an Add-On feature, it didn't come online until the middle of our campaign, so a lot of our early backers may have missed out. This store allows us to get you extra copies for a friend, let's you pick up any of the "Brick Series" of alt-covers you might want, it's the ONLY place to get the special 6th S.I.S. cloth uniform patches just like those featured in issue #4, and much much more. So take a peek at the link below, and use password: T   for exclusive access.

First, more big thanks, we've crossed $7000!
This is an amazing level of support for Major Holmes & Captain Watson, not to mention a personal record for any of my campaigns, so thanks again to everyone who has pre-ordered the books.  We're grateful for everyone who came back for more, for all the new readers, and all the shares on social media and with friends. I've talked before about how our approach to Kickstarter has always been to make the books first, mostly so that delivery times are really fast. That's true, but these successful campaigns also help us fund the books, and this level of support is a huge leg-up on getting an all-new story arc of Major Holmes & Captain Watson up and running. We've got plans involving some of the biggest events in WWI and in world history for the 6th S.I.S. to get mixed up in, and as you'll see once you get your hands on these issues, there are challenges ahead for the new Holmes & Watson.

campaign.story:
This is a story about a modern day superhero.
SOLDIER focuses on Daniel Krug. He's a heroic firefighter, father of five, SWAT trainer, amateur MMA champion and armored combat enthusiast. Daniel is also a former military sniper, with combat, security, rescue and recovery experience in the middle east and Tibet. Frankly, Daniel is as close to a superhero as there is! 
But SOLDIER is about much more than him. In the past 8 years, he's lost 9 of his close friends to suicide. And that’s the reason he's partnered with me to tell his story. 
PLAY

This is a story about getting back up.
Daniel wrote this to me early on, and it's worth repeating here. "This isn’t just a story about war… or being a veteran. This is a story about suffering through trauma. This is about a world of people who silently struggle through the pain of PTSD. It’s about those of us who get up, focus our sights on the horizon… and soldier on." 
We're going to be getting into this stuff. I'll be interviewing family, friends and coworkers. We'll all be talking about loss and fortitude... straight up and honestly. And we'll be filming a lot of awesomeness! For example: one of Daniel's current pastimes featured below.
PLAY

This is a story about action.
I’ve been making award-winning films for almost 20 years, and I’ve never been more focused on a project. I have a largely volunteer team of incredible creators working with me to record all aspects of Daniels’ life, and we’ve received permission to capture some of the most amazing things you’ll ever see on film. We're talking everything from SWAT courses to one-on-one armored combat trials in a literal ring of fire.
I've also gathered - and am working with a team to professionally scan - thousands of pictures, along with archiving countless hours of old footage of Daniel's life and travels. 
Daniel's favorite photograph.
This is a story that deserves to be told. 
I've spent almost half a year building the team, outlining the 2021 schedule and shooting tests for SOLDIER... and we are ready to launch! Our budget includes everything to make the film I want to make: multiple field and interview days, storage drives for an extraordinary amount of 4K footage, archival still and video clean-up, editing, audio mixing, an original score, color correction sessions... and even an initial round of film festival submissions. It ALSO includes the 10% that goes to Kickstarter and charge fees, as well as taxes. Come join us on this adventure. We can't do it without you.
Prototype t-shirts tested for maximum softness by my kitty, Miyazaki.
Speaking of you...
I've prepared a number of reward tiers that reflect my commitment to local businesses. From hand-illustrated silkscreen t-shirts (with Endgame Clothing) to Portland printed DVD covers, post cards and poetry sheets (with StevensIS), you'll not only be backing an important film, you'll be backing family owned shops and receiving exclusive items. And as far as the t-shirts go, you'll get multiple design options. (Kitty not included.)
The team.  
Justin, Jordan and Scott. Photo by Juliana.
Justin Zimmerman: Director, Editor, Producer, Additional Camera. My personal work with www.brickerdown.com has been in over 150 film festivals worldwide, I was on the producing team of the 2014 Sundance Jury Award-winner Rat Pack Rat and my story with Spider-Gwen co-creator Robbi Rodriguez was part of the 2017 Eisner Award-winning Best Anthology Love is Love. I was the creative lead on multiple projects for Cisco Systems and Getty Images, and I'm a director at a graphic novel publishing company. As I’ve been a comic creator for a decade and a movie maker for two decades, I understand how to build an independent project from the ground up.
Jordan Eusebio: Production Sound, Dialogue Editor, Mixer. Jordan Eusebio is a Filipino-American sound designer and producer living in Corvallis, Oregon. He has over ten years of professional experience as an on-set and studio mixer. He’s worked with me on several projects over the years, on both production and post-production sides. 
Scott Ballard: Director of Photography. Scott Ballard is an award-winning Portland-based filmmaker. His credits include director of photography for nine feature films, producer of six feature films, and he’s written/directed/produced three personal feature films. He's shot multiple internationally recognized projects for me, in both documentary and narrative worlds.
Brian Sniffen: Legal Counsel. Brian has represented my work for years. His practice – Wildwood Law Group - focuses on intellectual property and business transactions, often involving obtaining, enforcing, and monetizing clients’ intellectual property rights.
And let's not forget... Brandon Reed: Producer. Torrance Maurer: Post-Production Supervisor. Matt Esteron: VFX. Juliana Patrick: Set Photographer. Ethan Claunch & Jim Choma: Art. 
Scott, Justin, Jordan and Daniel. Photo by Juliana.
Thank you.
Truly, thanks for checking out the campaign. We certainly hope you’ll consider backing and spreading the word. Stay safe out there, and wish us luck.
