updates.update_content:
Hi Kickstarter,
I know I left the last post on a bit of a cliffhanger: "What happened with Skywatch??"
I'm guessing many of you probably already know the answer-- because a couple days later, the cat leapt out of the bag in the form of a press release of sorts, out on the greater internet. Somehow it made it into all the major entertainment industry trade publications!

Hey Kickstarter,
With everything going on in the world, it feels like years have passed since we released Skywatch online. These months have been a whirlwind – for a whole slew of reasons. The beginnings of COVID-19 felt like a dystopic sci-fi movie... and that was just the beginning of the 2020 rollercoaster. My relationship with social media has been challenged a bit too; against the backdrop of Hugely Important Things, it feels a bit solipsistic to be demanding space on the internet for my dinky lil short film.

Today's the big day! 
So proud to finally share SKYWATCH with you – and the entire internet.
Huge, huge thanks to each and every one of you for helping us get to this point. I'm so proud of what we managed to pull off.
Now. Dim the lights, crank the volume...and ENJOY the full film!

Hi all!
The short film releases to the world in just 24 HOURS!! Really could use your help spreading the YouTube link far and wide. I'll be updating everyone at this time – 8am PST – tomorrow. :)
In the meantime! Wanted to post about the "NexPort Commercial." As you may (or may not) recall, our big "Stretch Goal" back in 2017 was to shoot a new opening for the short film.

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing NexPort: The Future of Home Delivery
updates.update_content:
Howdy all! Only FOUR DAYS to go before the big Online Release.
Four days!!
You and I have some catching up to do, but first: just wanted to say how excited I am that we're finally, finally here. I've never worked on something as long as I've worked on Skywatch... and I hope to keep it that way! 😛

The time has finally come to share SKYWATCH with the world!
In just two weeks, we'll be releasing the short online. (Can you believe it?? I couldn't sleep last night I was so excited.)
So mark your calendars! The big day is Wednesday, December 4th, 2019.
Our talented friend Bailey Kalesti produced this fantastic Teaser Poster:

Hey all,
Good news! Things are starting to get real. First: Skywatch is screening THIS MONTH at the Austin Film Festival! That's right, we're finally having our WORLD PREMIERE. AFF is an awesome festival (one of the very few I've actually attended before!), and hopefully it's the first of many.
So: I'll be in Austin, TX for the two screenings, on Oct. 25th & 28th. If any backers are in the area or want to come out and see it on the big screen, please reach out! I have tickets!

campaign.story:
UPDATES:
2/1 - New stretch goals added!
 BAROQUE POP is an eighty-page comic anthology produced by Mario Candelaria and is being released by Red Stylo Press. Inspired by the music of Lana Del Rey, Baroque Pop is a carefully curated selection of short form comics and illustrations celebrating love, loss, success, and change by comic creators who came together after finding mutual solace and inspiration in her music.
Cover by Jim Towe
 Baroque Pop is both an homage to Lana as well as a testament to the imagery and symbolism this modern day muse draws out of artists and writers. Her melodies invoke a sense of longing and wonder and endless hope. Mixed with instrumental tracks that feel cinematic in scope, her tunes practically invite the imagination to run wild painting tiny pictures with the emotions released in every bar, in every hook, until each album resembles a mosaic reflecting our deepest desires and secrets with each subsequent listening
In keeping with the music theme, the book itself will be printed at 7x7 inches to physically resemble a 45 RPM record cover.
Since production on the anthology is close to being wrapped, this campaign is to help fund a modest printing run so we will be able to start shipping out the books right away.
The book features seven short stories by:
♢ Chuck Harrison & Luke Marrone
♢ Daniel Charles & Ashley St. Lawrence (with Scott Ewen)
♢ Jennie Wood & Chris Goodwin
♢ Enrica Jang & Jan Velazquez
♢ Mario Candelaria & Katarzyna Witerscheim
♢ Michael Lynch & Mira Mortal
♢ Eric Palicki & Daniel Earls
And five portraits by:
♢ Jim Towe
♢ Adam Ferris (feat. Lesley Atlansky)
♢ John Keaveney
♢ Hoyt Silva
♢ Fabian Lelay (feat Lesley Atlansky)
We are coming to Kickstarter because this is a small creator owned passion project that was put together entirely by fans of Lana. While we have high hopes, anthologies are still a very niche market that many mainstream publishers will not take a chance on unless there are big rewards in it for them. This is a book by the fans for the fans and we have known this from the project's conception.
Putting this anthology together ourselves means we have direct control of how the final product looks. A painstakingly large level of detail has gone into designing this book. From the beginning we set out to distinguish ourselves from other anthologies. From the 7x7 square shape of the book to the higher quality paper to the perfect gold foil on the cover, everything was designed to put quality over quantity and that expense is reflected below in the goal.
Since the book has been completed it will still be released if we do not make our goal, but it will remain in a digital format until the collective can raise the funds to produce a modest print run -- and given this age of pirating, that would likely take a while. This is a passion project and it needs passionate support.
Goal breakdown.

*No Guarantee that your book will get picked up, as it's a CRAZY industry, but I'll do everything in my power to get your book noticed and give it the best opportunity.

campaign.story:
CARELS RING by SHANNON LENTZ
An old man trapped on a suicidal, planet sized super-computer, escapes and goes searching for his unknown grandchild.
CAYRELS RING - Issue One "Rend it"
Cayrels Ring is a 40 page, full color comic book that builds a new galaxy, featuring many worlds and many people. The first story arc, "Rend It", is told in eight chapters with each chapter being illustrated by a different artist.
I’ve called this unique process the STACKS UNIVERSE as it takes multiple short stories, illustrated by different artists, stacking them up to make a single cohesive story. 
"Rend It" follows many narratives including that of Jamitch, a scientist trapped on a planet sized supercomputer gone suicidal. Jamitch manages to escape and goes searching for his unknown grandchild. The fallout of his actions and the fate of the suicidal supercomputer is far reaching.
This first story in CAYRELS RING sets the table for a wealth of stories about those who live and die in this far away Ring Galaxy. 
Here is a sneak peak at the first chapter with art by Alchemichael and colors by Cassie Kelly.
Cayrels Ring is the brainchild of writer Shannon W. Lentz. He has gathered up some of the top indie comic book talent to collaborate and bring life to this complex galaxy.
BRANDON GRAHAM
Brandon Graham is an artist and writer known for his amazing books including KING CITY, Escalator, Walrus, MULTIPLE WARHEADS, and the Extreme relaunch of PROPHET, which he writes and sometimes draws. He also is the co-curator of the comics anthology/magazine Island also published by Image Comics.
Multiple Warheads by Brandon Graham
SIMON ROY
Simon's work can be seen in the pages of PROPHET(Image Comics) where he helped create some of the best, most mind bending  science fiction recently seen in the North American comic scene. He recently wrapped up working on his book HABITAT, also published by Image comics.
Habitat by Simon Roy
FAREL DALRYMPLE
Farel Dalrymple created an amazing book called THE WRENCHIES, from First Second Books. Farel’s Eisner nominated webcomic, IT WILL ALL HURT is available in three comics book issues from Study Group Comics. Delusional, (Adhouse, 2013) is a collection of personal work, comic short stories, illustrations, and sketches. Farel was also the artist on Omega the Unknown (Marvel Comics 2010), with writer Jonathan Lethem. His creator owned comic book, Pop Gun Wars which has recently been featured in ISLAND (Image comics). He also did some amazing work in PROPHET (see below).
Spread by Farel Dalrymple from the pages of PROPHET #29.
ALCHEMICHAEL
Alchemichael has been making a name for himself through his fantastic Tumblr feed as well as his work on HEART OF WEIRDNESS. You'll see his work featured onthis months cover of ISLAND Magazine. Alchemichael's art is also seen above in the first Chapter of Cayrels Ring.
Heart of Weirdness by Alchemichael and Seth Jacob
AARON CONLEY
Aaron is the artist and co-creator of SABERTOOTH SWORDMAN (Second edition coming out next month) from Dark Horse Comics and the 2014 winner of the prestigious Russ Manning Promising Newcomer Award.  His work can be found in the Marvel comics Rocket Raccoon & Groot #4 and Secret Wars: Battleworld #3 as well as several other amazing books.
SABERTOOTH SWORDSMAN by Aaron Conley and Damon Gentry
GRIM WILKINS
Grim Wilkins has been drawing and self-publishing comics for the better part of a decade. He is known for his creatively composed comics pages and surprisingly whimsical characters. His work can currently be seen in the pages of PROPHET (Image Comics) and Speculative Relationships 2, as well as Little Nemo: Dream Another Dream (Locust Moon Press), in various Spectrum annuals and CFSL Artbooks, and in his old self-published comics like Love Story in the Woods and Ellipses. You might know him from his two successful Kickstarters for MIRENDA.
Mirenda by Grim Wilkins
 FILYA BRATUKHIN 
Mysterious young super artist out of Russia. I seriously know little about this man other than he is one talented dude. Filya makes Darrows hands ache simply by looking at his work. Check-out his Tumblr. I'm sure you'll be seeing his work in other books soon.
FILYA BRATUKHIN
 AARON PETOVELLO
Aaron writes and draws a web comic about the first World War. 
Pro Patria Mori by AARON PETOVELLO
 CASSIE KELLY
The book will be colored by Cassie Kelly. An artist and colorist whose color work has appeared in Cluster (Boom Studios) and Invader Zim (Oni).

A digital copy of CAYRELS RING. 
ASTEROID

We are offering local pick-up and along with your copy of CAYRELS RING being signed by the local Vancouver team working on the project. “Built to” (working title) is a site-specific dance project that combines the worlds of sustainability and the performing arts. This collaborative project between LEAFHouse and Chelsea Boyd Brown & Collaborators explores the idea of sustainable structures in our relationships, our anatomy, our houses, and our planet. During “Built to,” audience members will be led on an experience around and through LEAFHouse. Come watch dancers near and far, hear local music, add plants to the green wall, and taste local foods. This is an immersive event for all audiences! 
Performances are Saturday, May 13th, 2017 at 5pm and 7pm. Tickets must be purchased in advance, as audience sizes are limited. Ticket information coming spring 2017.

campaign.story:
Welcome to our 30th Anniversary Season!
As Merce Cunningham would say, "And we begin... again."
JERUSALEM, ISRAEL, January 2017: We begin our newest collaboration with Zvi Sahar, the brilliant Israeli artistic director of PuppetCinema. His performance of "Salt of the Earth" last spring blew us away with his artistry, sublime imagery and lighting Orson Welles would savor. Stay tuned for this remarkable journey that will take us deeper into where we long to be....
ESSEN, GERMANY, June 2017: Deep in the heart of Pina Bausch land, we have been invited to create a site-specific dance with PWDT and Folkwang Tanz Studio, the resident professional dance company of Folkwang University that used to be directed by Pina herself. Over three weeks, we will be rehearsing in the stunningly cool SANAA building and on the grounds of one of the region's most significant and beautiful coal and iron foundries.
BATES DANCE FESTIVAL, August 2017: In July we will return to the Bates Dance Festival for a performance and classes, celebrating the legacy of the one and only director Laura Faure. Not only has Laura supported our work for over twenty years, but has nurtured a utopian dance community for thousands of people throughout the world.
And since our last Kickstarter:
CUBA, February 2016: Thanks to your support, we began 2016 with a PWDT tour to Cuba, where we performed, taught workshops, and began collaborating on a site-specific performance installation in a gorgeous 16th century fort in Old Havana. We are hoping to return in 2018 to premiere the work in celebration of its designation as a UNESCO world heritage site.
SENEGAL, June 2016: In June we spent a week at the iconic Ecole des Sables, created by the visionary mother of African contemporary dance, Germaine Acogny. A dream come true for Patrik – this was the school he had hoped to attend at the very beginning of his dance career. Throughout the week, we were immersed in classes, performances, and discussions with emerging dance artists from 14 African countries, and started a beautiful friendship with Germaine.
JOE'S PUB, NYC, September 2016: We previewed our new solos this past fall at the Dance Now Festival – Patrik's "...and still doing", inspired by a dream he had of Yoko Ono, and Sara's "The Beginning of Forgiveness." Deborah Jowitt wrote: ..."the effect is one of both confinement and wildness... rueful, witty, heart-twisting."
WASHINGTON, DC, October 2016: We premiered a new site dance for the Dance Place Gala honoring directors Carla Perlo and Deborah Riley who will be retiring this year – what an honor to be invited to celebrate these remarkable women!
Throughout these 30 years – thanks to you – we have been able to tour with our company throughout Europe, Latin Armerica, and Asia, from NYC to Beijing to Kyoto, from Lincoln Center to the Kennedy Center, from the London Dance Umbrella to the International Dance Festival in New Delhi, from working with at risk girls and Somali immigrants in Lewiston, Maine to collaborating with martial artists, bakers, musicians, planners and remarkable dance artists thought the world.
Please support our newest collaborations in Israel and Germany!
We need your help to raise $10,000 to make these invitations a reality. We have already secured $30,000 from grants and commissions, and now look to you.
We are so grateful for your belief in our work, and for your generous help throughout these years.
With kansha, that untranslatable Japanese word that is a mixture of appreciation and awe.
Sara & Patrik

campaign.story:
Hi, I’m Jeff McComsey!
 I am a cartoonist working in comics for the past 9 years. I’m usually here asking for your support on a new comic project, but this time I need your help with something a little different.
I'm here seeking funds to produce my pocket size thumbnail sketch book for cartoonists: THUMB BOOK. 
 ALL REWARDS WILL SHIP IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS 2016!
 WHERE IT ALL STARTED:
Like most cartoonists and comic artists, I did my thumbnails on loose paper and I would inevitably lose them in the sea of paper in my studio. My initial solution was an improvised thumbnail template stapled together. I’ve been refining this template and booklet for the past two years.
Thumbnails from last year's prototype Thumb Book.
Last year I made a prototype Thumb Book that I shared with some of my cartoonist friends and got some great feedback. I’ve incorporated that feedback into this final version of the THUMB BOOK.
Thumb Book cover and inside template.
SPECS:
The THUMB BOOK is 4.25”x 5.5”and is currently 66 pages - I'm hoping to add pages via stretch goals if possible - designed to be a pocket sized sketch book with a template on each page that corresponds to the layout of a standard comic page. Originally created to help me keep all my preliminary work in one spot, I also like them because I can grab a script, pencil, Thumb Book and hit a coffee shop if I need a change of scenery.
SEQUENTIAL ART TEACHERS:
In addition to working in comics, I am also an adjunct professor at Pennsylvania College of Art and Design. In this coming Spring semester I’ll be teaching a class called Visual Storytelling and I want to incorporate these sketchbooks into the curriculum. If this campaign is successful, I’ll be providing all 20 students with THUMB BOOKS.
-If you teach a sequential art/comics based art class and think these books could be helpful for your students, please shoot me a message.
HOW I USE THEM:
Once I have a script in hand I do small breakdowns four up on the Thumb Book page. After that each breakdown gets taken to a full (Thumb Book) page layout. I try and make those thumbnails as tight as possible. I then scan those thumbnails and enlarge them to begin the penciling stage.
My two part Thumb Book process.
I believe that minutes spent refining thumbnails will save hours on the finish of the final page. 
THUMBNAIL THEATER:
24 page, same size thumbnail mini comic reproduction of my one-shot issue: THE BANG. Hopefully the first in a series of thumbnail mini comics.
WHO ELSE COULD USE THESE?
The Thumb Book is designed for cartoonists, but I have writer friends that used them to do rough layouts they pass along to the art team with their scripts. The Thumb Book can also be used for story boarding and includes a page in the back that details how to make various aspect ratios from the existing template.
REWARDS:
I’ve included reward tiers where you can just try out one book, order multiples or sponsor a class and provide them with Thumb Books.
Post it note commission examples
I’ve also got a bunch of original art rewards in case any non-cartoonist friends would like to support the project. 
-If there’s some combination of rewards you would like and don’t see on here, just drop me a message and we’ll get it sorted out!
Original thumbnail examples.
  MOTHER RUSSIA mini series reward.
   MOTHER RUSSIA sketch cover examples.
  11x17 original art and thumbnail examples.
THANKS FOR LOOKING! 
I've found these little books to be very helpful and have designed my comic making process around them. I hope they might be helpful to other creators too. If you're still here, thanks for looking!

campaign.story:
There will come a time when you look in the mirror and you see all you will ever be. But you have to accept it, because your other option? Kill yourself...or stop looking in mirrors.
Sleep Inertia Pilot Slicing Through the Foam of the Days Like a Radial Saw on a Stone Heart is a very personal story for Valentin, and is unlike anything he has created before. It is a unique and sublime reading experience, one we want to share with readers. We will use the funds raised to create this 100-page masterpiece, print copies and ship them to backers, so everyone can experience this once-in-a-lifetime graphic novel.
a Graphic Novel by Valentin Ramon
  In a future that is just around the corner, people have given up on living their own lives and have allowed governments and corporations to dictate their fate. 
Why people leave their lives in the hands of fate and the day-to-day inertia of living is still a mystery for everyone.
SIP is the story of a 100-year-old woman who refuses to die at a time where the average lifespan ends at 70. She has been waiting for a long time to die, but demands to control the moment and manner that she dies in. If you knew you were going to die, wouldn’t you want to choose the time and place and reason it happens, and make your death worth something?
SIP is about how everything that is around us makes us who we are and how the reality that surround us can sometimes not be what it seems to be. This book has a pacemaker made of sad drama at its heart, and a brain tumor of black comedy plaguing it.
  Page 1
  Page 2
  Page 3
  Page 4
  Page 5
  Page 6
  SIP is a 100-page original graphic novel with a fixed 8 panel grid per page. It's a story about love, loss and melancholia written and illustrated by Valentin Ramon, best known for his work as the illustrator of D4VE and Hot Damn (IDW), with co-writer Mark Bertolini, creator of Scum of the Earth (Action Lab Danger Zone), and Micah Myers (Action Lab, Zenescope, Scout) on letters.
  We choose Kickstarter for the freedom that it gives us as creators. To have total freedom on the creative side with a project like this is always the most important thing a creator can ask for. While we love to work with publishers, sometimes having someone overseeing the project and asking you to take this out and put that in will change the sense of the book, especially when it is such a personal story. We want to create something unique for readers. After the cost to print and ship the book, plus Kickstarter's fees, the remaining funds will be used to buy time for the authors to create the book.
  We have all been working in the comic book industry for a long time, and we have never missed a deadline, and we don’t plan on missing this one either. We have a good amount of work already finished, and we have set up a working schedule to make sure we have time to finish creating this book in time to hit our delivery goal for next year. We are professionals and we intend to complete this book in a professional and timely manner.

campaign.story:
THE COMIC
GWAR: ORGASMAGEDDON is a blasphemous and blood-drenched 4-issue (5 issues as a stretch goal) full-color comic book series by shock rock legends GWAR, writer Matt Miner (Toe Tag Riot, Critical Hit), artist Jonathan Brandon Sawyer (Welcome Back, Critical Hit), colorist Marissa Louise (RoboCop, Escape from New York), letterer Taylor Esposito (The Paybacks, Red Hood and the Outlaws) and editor Brendan Wright (Archie vs. Predator, Grindhouse: Doors Open at Midnight). 
Having violated the art, music and film worlds, now infamous Scumdogs GWAR are coming for your comic books! 
Do you need to be a GWAR fan to love this series? Hell no! There's loads of laughs and violence, fun, and social satire for everyone to enjoy!
Did you know GWAR isn't only the best heavy metal band in the known (and unknown universe) but they're ancient intergalactic aliens responsible for the creation of the human race?  Read the GWAR mythos HERE and get up to speed!
THE STORY
Straight outta Antarctica, come along for a ride with heavy metal Gods of Gore and masters of all that lives GWAR, as they bumble their way through time, making friends, killing friends, and drowning the entire human timeline in blood, bile, and, err . . . other fluids, explaining once and for all the question on everyone's minds: "How the hell did we get here, and why is everything so damn effed up?!"  
It's gonna be a bloodbath, a royal rumble, and the touching story of a boy and the dead dog he loves all rolled up into the awesomest and most violently vulgar time-travel comic story to ever grace your pathetic human eyeballs!
Issue 1 standard cover - art by Jonathan Brandon Sawyer, color by Josh Jensen

GWAR - from planet Scumdogia to your comic shop's shelves, every issue has contributions by GWAR and Slave Pit members

                              WHY KICKSTARTER?
Making comics is a lot of work, and people don't work for free, or at least they shouldn't. Each page of this gorgeous art equals days of labor for the creative team. While we're not able to match DC or Marvel page rates, we feel it's important that folks are able to do things like eat and pay their bills while making rad comics.

There is a great publisher onboard to publish GWAR: Orgasmageddon, as long as we can pay the art and creator costs with the successful Kickstarter.

updates.update_userinfo: Only 5 days left for DEATH TRAP! Don't miss out!!
updates.update_content:
Hey all, I thank anyone who still reads these updates and please know that I love you.  Building a career in comics, when you're an opinionated loudmouth with something to say, is especially tough.  It means I have to reach out to you folks, and sometimes, like today, I have to reach out for maybe the third time?  I'm not sure.
What I do know is that DEATH TRAP is in the home stretch, but we only have 5 days left.  Please check it out?  Please pledge.  I swear to you, this is a beautifully illustrated book with a ton of heart, a lot of bananas fun, and just enough of my point of view that you'll be like "Ah, he snuck that in there, nice."

Loved & Lost is an anthology collecting 9 stories about navigating through the treacherous waters of modern romance and discovering that not all relationships work out the way you expect.
On the Stump by Mac Cooper
All 9 stories are written by Tyler Chin-Tanner and illustrated by a different artist or art team. The collection is almost entirely done but we need your help to finish the production and get this book printed!
Team Spirit by Robert Ryan, Thaw by Tadd Galusha

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After having having run the successful Kickstarter campaign for the Broken Frontier anthology and then having it printed and delivered to backers, I can assure you that anthologies present a number of challenges. But they weren't anything we couldn't handle at the time and we're even better prepared for them now. 

First and foremost, we've collected the stories ahead of time so there won't be a wait for them to come in. We've already arranged the details with the printer, and we're much more experienced in how to ship the books safely to backers all over the world.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Announcing our new anthology - All We Ever Wanted!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
I don't like to do too many post-campaign updates, but I knew it would be worth it to let you all know about my new project, ALL WE EVER WANTED: Stories of a Better World an anthology filled with stories meant to inspire us and restore the belief that a brighter future is possible.
Go check it out and back the project!

LOVED & LOST is finally in print! The books came in yesterday and they look great! I sent out surveys the other day, so make sure you fill them out. I'm putting the packages together now and plan to start mailing them after the 4th. I'm pretty sure I can get everything in the mail by the end of the week, so you should have your books soon (and other goodies depending on which tier you backed).
Here's a photo of all the rewards together:

Hi Everyone,
The Loved & Lost anthology is now on ComiXology which means all of you get your download codes. I'll be sending them out in individual messages so look out for them today.
Once you have your code, go to this link (I'll also include it in the message), add the book to your cart, then go to your cart and click on the option to "redeem a code" and enter it there. It's as simple as that.

Hi friends,
My name is Eric Grissom and I write comics and sometimes I write comics that Claire Connelly draws. Our latest collaboration, inspired in part by our mutual love of The Legend of Zelda, is called THE MARK and it’s the story of a young woman who becomes cursed after burning wood from a sacred tree in the forest near her village. It’s a dark and moody fairy tale that we’re telling through 82+ pages of sequential art and verse. It’s half poetry, half comics and appropriate for all ages.
The good news about this project is it's already done. The only thing that remains is for a beautiful hardcover edition to be printed up, but in order to do that we need money - specifically $5500 to cover the cost of printing the book for our backers, covering Kickstarter and CC fees, and meeting the minimum quantity required by our printer. Any left over copies of the book we'll have we'll be able to sell at shows, to book and comic stores, and on places like Amazon. 
We’re selling the hardcover for 25 bucks which we feel is the ideal format to read this story in, however if digital is more your thing we’re offering that too. 
So here we are. Asking for your help in making this book a reality. If you look over our reward tiers I’m sure you’ll find something that works for you. Along with THE MARK you can get copies of PIGS and CHICKENS - two comics Claire and I did together previously. 
Chickens and Pigs are two comics Claire and I did in our ANIMALS series.
  ANIMALS is more adult oriented, so if you’re getting THE MARK for a kid you might want to keep the ANIMALS books for yourself.
So there you have it. Thanks again for watching and checking out the project. Please consider backing it.
Digital Rewards
If you back this project with one of our digital comic rewards, you will have the option of having the comics delivered to your ComiXology account.

BLOOD BROTHERS (HERMANOS DE SANGRE) is a 104 page graphic novel. It introduces Diego and Gabriel Soliz, who work for the police department fighting monsters and solving mysteries. 
It's a supernatural pulp story with fantasy elements, that takes place in a world where the border between reality and fantasy/mythology was broken. In this city, when crimes of a supernatural nature occur, it's up to Diego (the hard-boiled detective) and Gabriel (the luchador) to use their skills to solve them.
The city is filled with beings from fantasy and mythology!
  GABRIEL SOLIZ THE LUCHADOR!
The story also explores the relationship between these two brothers, and how they each obtained the special talents that enable them to do battle with the supernatural!
LOS HERMANOS!
Artist Javier Caba and myself are very excited to explore this world, and introduce you all to these fun characters, so in order to get this project off the ground, we have some awesome rewards up for grabs!

campaign.story:
What Is Flutter?
Flutter is about Lily, a girl who shapeshifts into a boy to get her dream girl and the chaos that comes from pretending to be someone she's not. That chaos continues in Volume Three: Hey Mom, Why So Tense? 
 In Volume Three, while shapeshifting, Lily gets stuck in a body, but not just any body - her mother's. Forced to see the world through the eyes of her estranged mother, Lily must accept that she'll never live a "normal life" in order to fulfill her true destiny. 
Flutter is a comic series that began over five years ago in a writing class at Grub Street, Boston's independent writing center. Since then, Flutter has been featured on Law & Order: SVU, in The New York Times, and in the Boston Globe. Flutter is one of the best LGBT graphic novels of 2013 and 2015, according to The Advocate. Bleeding Cool lists it as one of the 15 best indie comics of 2014. 
Most recently, the Virginia Library Association named Volume Two a 2015 Graphic Novel Diversity Award Honor Book. Volume Two was also named a 2015 INDIEFAB Book of the Year finalist by Foreword Reviews. For me, though, the biggest thrill of all was when comic legend Gail Simone described Flutter, Volume One as "a truly thrilling graphic novel."
 I have always envisioned Flutter as a three volume graphic novel series, so this is the final volume of this story arc. I'm a 'never say never' person, so I'm not saying that this is the very end of all things Flutter. There's a chance that it will show up in another format, but this story arc, this graphic novel series published by 215 Ink, is ending with Volume Three.
To celebrate, we're combining all three volumes into THE FLUTTER COLLECTION, a 300+ page full color book, and offering it as a reward in this Kickstarter campaign. Only a limited number of THE FLUTTER COLLECTION will be printed. This campaign is the only place where you can guarantee that a copy is yours. 
The Flutter Collection combines all three volumes in one 300+ page full color book
 Who Is Flutter?
Flutter is Jeff (FUBAR) McComsey, Chris Goodwin, Jeff (THE TICK) McClelland, and me. 
Flutter, Volume One started with me writing the script and Jeff McComsey doing everything else: art, colors, and lettering. Jeff and I met through a mutual friend who was teaching the comic / graphic novel writing class that I took at Grub Street. 
McComsey and I decided to expand the team for Volume Two, adding Chris Goodwin as colorist and Jeff McClelland as letterer. The way Chris got involved was pretty funny. Chris and I both had day jobs at the same publisher. When he stopped by to tell me he was leaving his job, I told him that McComsey and I needed a colorist for Volume Two. When I mentioned the date we needed the pages by, Chris said, "That's crazy! That's impossible!" 
He came back to my desk twenty minutes later and said he wanted to try to meet the crazy, impossible deadline. The result was Volume Two. 
Jeff McComsey and Chris Goodwin, NYCC 2015
All four of us are back for Volume Three. As well as lettering, Jeff McClelland will also be handling the editing duties of both Volume Three and THE FLUTTER COLLECTION. 
McClelland has been in the trenches with me at comic conventions and with print deadlines. He is always there with a bottle of Cheerwine and a solution for making any situation, any page of Flutter better. 
Jeff McClelland and Me, SDCC 2016
Why We Need Funds 
Flutter is an indie comic on a very small press. We prefer it that way because we get to tell the story we want to tell, how and when we want to tell it. However, that means the burden of the production and printing costs falls on us. 
Producing and printing full color 100+ page graphic novels is expensive. Like with our previous Flutter, Volume Two Kickstarter campaign, we need funds to produce and print enough copies of Volume Three to distribute it to comic stores. In addition, for this campaign, we also want to print a limited number of THE FLUTTER COLLECTION, a full color 300+ page book. 
Rewards, Stretch Goals, and Add-Ons 
Along with all the books, we have lots of other reward options. Jeff McComsey will draw you as an extra in Volume Three - you can even have a speaking role! There's also original and commissioned art by McComsey. The original art available for this campaign has been in multiple art exhibits this year. 
Flutter Original Art at Aviary Art Show, May 2016
There are special Cheerwine reward tiers, tributes to the soft drink from my hometown. The Cheerwine rewards include all the books and comics where the soft drink is mentioned. 
Page from a mini-comic in Honcho 3 Cheers
  Part of the Jennie Wood Collection rewards
  Part of the Cheerwine and Jennie Wood Collection Rewards
 We also have limited edition Flutter guitar picks and t-shirts. The Volume Two t-shirts from our last campaign will be available along with new options. You'll get to pick which one you want when we send out surveys. 
These T-Shirts and More Will Be Available to Backers
There are Volume Three scripts with commentary, a writing class with me, and limited edition bookplates from McComsey. And the first 100 backers of this campaign get an extra reward! If you have any questions about the rewards or this campaign, please email me at jrnayslayer@gmail.com.
Bookplate Rewards by Jeff McComsey
We have stretch goals planned, so stay tuned for those. We'll also be offering Add-Ons later in the campaign. For example, if you're torn between a T-shirt and an original art reward, you'll get a chance to add-on items to the reward you've selected at a later date. More details on all this soon. Thank you for your time, consideration, and support! 
Cheers,
Jennie

Hey guys! My name is April, I'm a self taught artist in Maryland. Art and creating have always been a passion of mine and through a lot of hard work I've been able to make it my full time job.
Sucker
 For the past 3 years I've focused all my energy on illustrating and creating art based goods, in order to share that passion with everyone. To keep this dream alive I have been traveling nearly every weekend to promote my work. While I am grateful for the adventures, I would also love a home base to truly call my own.
Chicago for C2E2
My work at an outdoor show, plus bonus stranger!

My dream has always been to open a retail store. I'm thinking Hampden, Baltimore. Having this space would allow me to keep my products readily available and give me more time to just WORK. Spending less time on the road will give me the opportunity to create more and become faster at my craft. Pretty soon, all this free time will allow me to take on more commissions (hooray for more portraits and tattoo designs!). campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS…
Now that we've past the first goal, check out our first stretch goal!
STRETCH GOAL #1: $6500: Cover Upgrade! If we can hit this first stretch goal I am going to upgrade the covers to have spot UV and make them all extra special! It'll be great to have Maya and Kardunn's tail really pop on the cover + a THANK YOU PAGE for every backer at the $25 level and above.
THE STORY...
The Creators is a story about a small portion of the world's young population who suddenly develop the power to bring their imaginations to life through their drawings.  This power, fueled by adolescent emotion, is simultaneously awesome and extraordinarily dangerous as Creators are only limited by their imaginations.
The story of The Creators is told through the eyes of a young girl named Maya. After suffering a traumatic loss, Maya brings forth a very special creation named Kardunn, who serves as her protector and friend as they run from the Bureau of Creative Enforcement, a government agency developed to hunt down and deal with all young creators.
THE CAMPAIGN...
I am proud to say that the book is completely finished. If you'd like you can check it all out at www.creatorscomic.com where it has lived for the past 2 years. The $5000 I am trying to raise with this campaign will be used to fund the printing of the full color, print edition of Volume 1 of The Creators. It will include chapters 1 through 6 of the comic - over 200 pages - that I have been working on for the last few years. Anything over the $5000 will be put towards stretch goals that will extend and add content to the book.
REWARDS…
Along with the book itself, I have come up with what I hope are some really exciting rewards and incentives for backing the campaign including...
   STRETCH GOALS…
STRETCH GOAL #1: $6500: Cover Upgrade!  If we can hit this first stretch goal I am going to upgrade the covers to have spot UV and make them all extra special!  It'll be great to have Maya and Kardunn's tail really pop on the cover
STRETCH GOAL #2 - $7500: One of my favorite parts of any graphic novel is the sketchbook section that highlights the character development process of a book. If we can hit $7500, I intend to go through the pages and pages of creature/creation sketches and hand pick the very best ones and make a sketchbook section to extend the book. It will include early sketches of characters that ended up in the book and sketches of creations that never made an appearance at all.
STRETCH GOAL #3 - $8,500: An 8 page guest comic illustrated by Kelsey Wailles of Super Art Fight and Doctor Kawai and written by yours truly will be added to the book. There are so many stories in the Creators universe that I just can't tell within the confines of the narrative but wish I could get out there. This short comic will look at a creator who is in a very different environment than any we see throughout the book. On top of that, Kelsey's lighthearted and animated visual style mixed with my darker storytelling makes for a really interesting collaboration.
STRETCH GOAL #4 - $10,000: Another guest comic! A 6 page comic written and illustrated by Alex Kazanas of Super Art FIght and the One Piece podcast. This story finds a way to cleverly explore ancient mythology and a troubled father and son relationship while fitting in beautifully to the creators universe.
STRETCH GOAL #5 - $12,000: A Pinup section will be added to the book! The final stretch goal will collect all of the amazing pinups I have gotten from colleagues in the comic and illustration world and add them to the book. This includes work from Nick 'Ghost Free Hood' DiFabbio, Jamie Noguchi (ypcomic.com) and more!
Producing this book has been a labor of love and a dream that I have followed for the past 4 years and I am excited to continue on with it. For anyone who has read and supported the comic so far, I thank you. To anyone about to take the leap and support this campaign, I hope you love this book as much as I loved making it. Thank you so much!
-Michael S Bracco

One of the biggest challenges when creating a comic of any kind is hitting a deadline. I am fortunate to have the entire book completely written, illustrated and designed so there are virtually no risks in completing the content in a timely fashion.

That leaves printing. I have made sure to research the printer that I will be using and have even met the team. Kraken print has a great reputation for producing quality books in a timely fashion. That said, there may be some delays with shipping that are out of my control. I will keep every backer updated as we progress so they know exactly what to expect and when to expect it!

Hello everyone!  I am so excited to be reaching out to you all after 18 months and share with you (before ANYONE else) that the Creators is returning!
The CREATORS, Volume 2: Strength in Unity KICKSTARTER will be starting first thing in the morning on Wednesday, April 25th and running through the month of May! campaign.story:
What's The Job?
Adrian and Julia Pryce were the best con artists in the world. He identified the marks and she fleeced them for millions. But when Julia walks into their empty New York penthouse, she realizes she only has a few minutes before Adrian's set-up puts her away for all their crimes. Julia makes a breathtaking escape and sets about her revenge by recruiting a team of thieves to steal Adrian's big scores before he can disappear to a life of ill-gotten luxury.
What's Your Angle?  
Let's turn this:  
Fancy script pages
Into this:
Fancier comic pages
With your help, we can turn Girls Heist Out from a collection of witty banter, assorted script pages and scenes in my head into a limited comic book series. Our goal nets us four digital issues that will be collected and printed into a physical trade paperback. You can follow along digitally when each issue releases or wait to read the whole story in one binge read.
We have a great artist on board to breath life into the characters of Girls' Heist Out. Manuela Soriani nailed the look and feel of the text. You see some examples throughout this page with new samples slated for sharing with backers throughout the fundraising campaign.
What's In It for Me? 
The script: As a backer of this Kickstarter, you become a player in this saga as it unfolds. You will receive a PDF of the first issue’s script – giving you a first hand look into the Girls’ Heist Out world before copies hit the shelves. Backers at any level can check out the working script for issue #1 right here.
Digital Issues: We'll be offering individual issues digitally. Single physical issues are out of my budget, but we expect regular digital releases to tide supporters over until the whole book comes out. 
Trade paperback: If we hit our funding goal, we'll print a trade paperback collecting all four issues of the mini-series. Stretch goal materials may include sketches and other add-ons that won't be repeated in subsequent printings of the book. 
Play games with the designer: Rob's worked on dozens of tabletop games over the past two decades. He will run a session any of those games over an internet chat client for you and your friends.
Product placement: Ever notice how in the movies, certain brands have prominence in the shot, while others are covered up or minimized? We'll work with you to integrate your business into a panel or two of an issue. 
Aliases: Seeing your name in print is a rare treat. Backers at these levels will work with Rob to see their names (or the names of their loved ones) used in the comic. You might get a chance to be an alias or even have a minor character named after you!
Cameos: There are plenty of thugs and security guards that will challenge the girls during their heists. Manuela has agreed to put some backers into the comic in these minor roles. All you have to do is pledge high enough and send up a couple of photos for her to use as reference. 
The mastermind (SOLD OUT!): Our BIGGEST reward is to be the bad guy pulling the strings at the end. This villain features prominently in the last issue. There's only ONE of these rewards available to a very generous backer.
What About Stretch Goals?
All part of the plan. If we raise more than our goal, we'll start unlocking more pages of the comics book and art prints by awesome guest artists.
UNLOCKED: An additional page by Manuela Soriani.  
UNLOCKED: Art print by Laura Guzzo
Alternate cover by Laura Guzzo
UNLOCKED: An additional page by Manuela Soriani.
UNLOCKED: Art print by Melissa Gay
Art print by Melissa Gay
$14,500: An additional page by Manuela Soriani.
$15,000: Art print by Diana Probst
$15,500: Art print by Vicky Tierney
Art print by Vicky Tierney
$16,000: Art print by Jayna Pavlin
$18,000: A set of four art prints by Melissa Brower featuring a portrait of each girl.
Sample art print by Melissa Brouwer
Where's The International Option?  
International shipping makes cowards of us all. Too many horror stories from other Kickstarter creators leaves me in a bind. Either I don't offer shipping to countries outside the US and lose a large source of potential backers or I watch as I send out packages that get damaged, destroyed or lost after international backers are already reeling from high shipping costs. Should Girls' Heist Out fund, I will look into international options after the Kickstarter, but I can only offer digital goods for those backers outside the US at this time.
What About Add-Ons?
To add one of these items on to your pledge, just increase the pledge by the amount of the add-on.
$10: An additional copy of an art print available to all backer levels receiving physical rewards.
$20: An additional copy of the comic book available to all backer levels receiving physical rewards.
$80: Rob will run one of the many games he's worked on as a game designer in one four hour session over an internet chat program for you and up to five other friends. Available to White Hat Hacker backers and above.
Why Should I Stick My Neck Out?  
If you love great work that comes from independent creatives, then join us on our Kickstarter adventure! By doing so, you will be supporting creator-owned comics and helping us bring this story of strong, independent women to comic lovers everywhere.
Dawn doesn't like to work on spec either.
What's the word on the street?
The Outhouser's Indie Huntress talks with Rob at length about the project.
Milwaukee Record talks about the Kickstarter here!
We get some love from Comic Bastards!
Comics for Sinners chimes in on their favorite girls!
Cambrian Comics talks about why its important to support creator comics like this!
Kind words from Gail Simone, writer of Batgirl, Birds of Prey, Secret Six and other fine comics too numerous to fit in this cap
John Rogers, creator of Leverage, speaks the truth.
Tasha Robinson of Onion A.V. Club and The Dissolve knows a thing or two about kickass women.
John Kovalic, creator of Dork Tower, Munchkin, Apples to Apples and more!
The company behind Deadlands, one of my favorite weird western RPGs!
Gene Ha sketches Julia Pryce
Who are the Girls?
Tina Echevarria doesn't mind spreading the wealth with Daniel, her trusty laptop, as long as she gets her cut off the top.
"Think retweeting their account info will be distracting enough?"
Century Cho gets her name from the dozens of identities she uses to slip into high society balls and low life dives.
"Trust is easy to lose, hard to win, but always, always valuable."
Dawn Montana is a hard-hitting, trash-talking gear head that's not afraid to break faces as well as hearts.
"You're about to learn the difference between being beaten by a girl and being beaten. By a girl."
Julia Pryce pulls these girls together to go after a jewel worth seven figures on the black market - and priceless sentimental value
"Darling, do you really need me to explain how I've won?"
Who are the creatives?
Rob Wieland: Author, game designer, professional nerd.
I'm Rob Wieland. I've been telling stories on tabletops for twenty years. I've worked on big licenses like Shadowrun, Firefly and Star Wars. I've worked on small games like Our Last Best Hope, CHILL 3rd Edition and The Edge of Midnight. My own worlds include CAMELOT Trigger and Save Game. 
Comics mean a lot to me. My grandfather taught me to read using comic books. I want to step out from tabletop game writing into creating comic books and Girls' Heist Out is the first story that's demanded to be told. I believe that creative people should consume what they create and it is a great time to be a comic book fan. This is a story inspired by my love of Darwyn Cooke and Ed Brubaker's Catwoman run, Gail Simone's Batgirl and Kurtis Wiebe's Rat Queens. 
Manuela Soriani: Artist, colorist, master of bubbles
Manuela Soriani lives in the same small town in northern Italy where she was born in 1979, in the heat of summer and fog in winter, near the river Po. Manuela studied to become an accountant but Art asked to be part of her life. So she answered the call, found a teacher (and later, friend), and became an artist.
After six years in comic books for the Italian market (including Jonathan Steele for Star Comics), Manuela began creating both traditional paper books and animated apps for electronic devices. In early 2016, she ran a successful Kickstarter for her first illustration book “Butterflies” and is working on the comic series TIN (by Ilya Dvilyanski) and BoyLord (by Nathan Peabody). She loves cats (she has two), the colors pink and orange, cooking, tabletop and roleplaying games (she enjoys some game design from time to time), videogames, and all forms of art.
Why Is It So Important To You?
Growing up as a kid in the 80's, I got to see movies and TV shows full of strong women kicking ass and taking names. Characters like Princess Leia, Ellen Ripley, Wilma Deering and Marion Ravenwood didn't swoon in the face of danger and got to play just as dirty as the boys did. I always admired clever heroes the most and these women always seemed to be one step ahead of the game. There are modern day equivalents, of course, like Furiosa, Rey and Starbuck, but we can always use more women who can think on their feet, talk their way out of (or into) trouble and throw down when there is no other option.
This idea became even more important to me at the beginning of this year. Girls' Heist Out is a couple years old as a project, but my daughter was born in January. She's already made this year a runaway smash success, but if I can help bring these characters to life and show her women not afraid to fight for what they want, I will feel like Dad of the Century. With your help, we can be holding these books in hand by her first birthday.
Already plotting something.

STRETCH GOALS!
and as a thank you for your support...
10 Years? What the heck is "Alterna" anyways?
Good question!
Alterna's a creator-owned comic book and graphic novel publisher. Yes, we've been around for 10 years and yes, you might be hearing about us for the first time.  The good news is, you're here now and now you know about us... and knowing is half the battle!
Alterna is funded by the creators that bust their butts to make the books.  We're not funded by investors, we're not owned by a multi-billion dollar corporate juggernaut. We're the little guy (yes, even after 10 years!) and we're taking to kickstarter to celebrate our 10 year anniversary with all of you!
So what are you making?
Loaded with good questions today, huh?
We're making TWO books... well, technically three (but who's counting)...
Book 1 - A 40 page FULL COLOR character guide filled with amazing characters from our creator-owned catalog.  Remember the trading cards of the 90's with all the cool character info on the back? This is kind of like that, but in comic book size and with one regular cover and one blank variant cover for artists and collectors!
Book 2 - An Alterna AnniverSERIES Anthology FILLED with some of our best stories from the past ten years. Some of this material has never seen print as it was only published digitally. There's also stretch goals in place to double the size of this book, up to 400 pages thick! Between its covers you'll find space-traveling children, swash-buckling sky pirates, zombies invading the battlefields of World War 2, sadistic prison guards, wise-cracking Area 51 agents, an alien with an identity crisis, a band on the run, an ass-kicking woman warrior with a demon-slaying hand of magic... and so much more! The Alterna AnniverSERIES Anthology is the absolute perfect addition for readers old and new.
Like us on FACEBOOK
Follow us on TWITTER
Click Here to Read a Brief History about Alterna!
CURRENT TITLES that will be represented in the Alterna AnniverSERIES Anthology!
The 40 page character guide is a LIMITED EDITION release with just 250 in print.  The Alterna AnniverSERIES anthology will boast 200 pages (and if we hit certain stretch goals, we'll upgrade the book's interior and cover stocks, and add an extra 200 pages PLUS make it full color!) will have a larger print run and will also be distributed in retail stores across the world. 
The $3500 goal will cover the print runs of the character guides (full color) and anthology (black & white), shipping, and kickstarter fees.  The more we raise, the more we'll be adding on!

Hello everyone!
I hope this message finds you well. I've got a new Kickstarter campaign up and I wanted to let you know about it since your support made this one possible.
It's a pre-order/pre-release for the film based on my comic, THE CHAIR. With every blu-ray/DVD combo, I'm including a Kickstarter-Exclusive fabric swatch of wardrobe that was worn by an actor in the film. It's a fun way to own a piece of movie (and Alterna Comics) history!

“The truth may be stretched thin, but it never breaks, and it always surfaces above lies, as oil floats on water.”
―Miguel De Cervantes, Don Quixote
Hi! My name is Jeff McComsey(MOTHER RUSSIA, FLUTTER), and I’m the editor in chief of the historical zombie anthology, FUBAR, and I’m back once again to ask for your support, but this time for my first full color, non FUBAR Creator owned project:
HONCHO
COVER ART BY: PIETRO
HONCHO is a post WWIII story of an American commando: Captain Donald Q. Stanley landing in what was once North Carolina on a mission to reach the stronghold of Charlotte.   
He claims to be on a mission for a president no one has heard of on behalf of a country that hasn't existed in 15 years.  
The central question of the story: Just how crazy is Captain Stanley?
HONCHO will be 75 pages to start but I hope to add pages for stretch goals.
Is he a damaged veteran of a nuclear world war finally returning home or a man on a top secret mission for the sitting president of a United States government in exile?  
Upon his arrival, he discovers a weird tribal structure made up of orphans from the civil wars that broke out in America post WWIII.  
These tribes have formed up around local baseball teams and team pride is perhaps the most important thing to this new way of life. If you’ve got a good arm then the sky’s the limit. If not, then you’re in deep shit.  
STRETCH GOALS!
   THE BANG!
COVER ART BY BRETT WELDELE
We’re also offering a 24 page one shot prequel to HONCHO called THE BANG which will be available with all reward tiers at $30 and over.  
This one-shot lays out the events that led up to the short and brutal Third World War that takes place in 1983, fifteen years before the events in HONCHO.
THE TEAM!
HONCHO will be co-written by myself and FUBAR Story Editor Jeff McClelland( THE TICK). I’ll be handling the art with colors by Mr. Paul Little( MORNING GLORIES, SONS OF ANARCHY).
We’re asking for funds to set aside the time and make these stories a reality.
REWARDS!
To get there we have a bunch of cool rewards where you can own both books, original art from either HONCHO or THE BANG, T-shirts, prints and a bunch of other sweet merch including some of my previous work like MOTHER RUSSIA and the AMERICAN TERROR series. We also have the kickstarter packages from our previous campaigns which both contain out of print books and comics!
If successful we plan to add pages on to both HONCHO and THE BANG through stretch goals as well as adding some other fun one shots too!  
Kickstarter remains the best place to offer new books to old fans first and make some new ones along the way.
As always, thank you for your time and thank you for your support!

campaign.story:
Stretch Reward!
So awesome folks. Anybody who pledged $25 or more I'm throwing in a coffee mug. You can use it for coffee or whatever. Milk, booze.. your choice. It looks rad like this...
$3,500 Stretch Goal!!!!
SOOOO!!! Things are going well! I thank everyone who has already pledged. Since we've reached the goal with time to spare I thought It would be cool to shoot for a stretch goal! At $3,500 I could have the interiors be spot color. I really dig a lot of books that have used this and the digital version looked great this way... So LETS GO!!!!
All My Ghosts is FINISHED!!! 
It's been published by ALTERNA Comics digitally through Comixology and other platforms now we need funds to print physical copies. It's 110 pages and it's dimensions are 7x7.  It's even going to be in Diamond and all that jazz we just need to cover the printing costs. There's a release date for February so let's get rolling!!
THE STORY
All MY Ghosts is about a newspaper man named Joe Hale. He owns and operates a local newspaper in a small Appalachian town a lot like mine. Times are tough and the economy is down the tubes so Joe is forced to sell the paper to an outside company that flips dying newspapers. The newspaper has been in Joe’s family for four generations so naturally there is a lot of guilt over his decision. Once the deal is made strange things start to happen… Joe starts slowly slipping out of control and writing abrasive opinion columns that start to piss off his readers and the community. Even Joe's friends and family start to drift away. Not only that but the building itself seems to be reacting to the changes brought on by the buyout. Strange possibly supernatural occurances become more frequent and eventually all of these events snowball into a jarring climax that will change Joe forever.
THIS PROJECT IS VERY NEAR AND DEAR TO ME 
I wrote the story, drew the pages and lettered the whole book. While doing this comic my family and I went through a lot of stuff, the death of both of my wife's parents, the birth of my second kid and on and on, and despite that I still finished it myself. The book is about the place I grew up and still live in, the Appalachian Mountains of Virginia. Like in the comic my town is in the middle of a harsh economic recession. The coal industry that once thrived here is all dried up and unemployment has skyrocketed. I wanted to do a book about the area and my experiences in this modern, southern, mountain town. 
THE ORIGIN
I struck on the idea of using a newspaper as a backdrop from my own experiences. I worked for a few years at a local newspaper as a graphic designer. Shortly after I started there the company was sold after being in the family of the owners for a number of decades. I also heard stories about noises and disturbances at night from the people who worked there late. Now we could chalk it up to exhaustion but I myself once saw a pretty freaky apparition out of the corner of my eye that rattled me working late one Sunday night. The idea for the book came from this time in my life.
REWARDS!!
At every level you get THE BOOK! There are also some cool prints available, a t-shirt, this B-horror slasher flick based on a comic I did and of course original page art!! Cool stuff!!!

campaign.story:
Meet Jane Bowles: incredible author, inspiring woman, tortured mind.
Jane may have been marginalized by the cultural canon, but her contemporaries considered her “one of the finest modern writers” (John Ashberry), “the most important writer of prose fiction” (Tennessee Williams), and further, a “genius imp, [a] laughing, hilarious, tortured elf” (Truman Capote). Jane drank more than she wrote, worried more than she worked, and had more epically disastrous love affairs than completed books. By almost any measure, Jane led a fascinating life filled with literary giants and great adventure and I want to bring her story to life.
Sketches of Jane at various ages by Tyler Jenkins
“Although unknown to the general public, the Bowleses were famous among those who were famous.” – Gore Vidal 
“My only complaint against Mrs. Bowles is that she publishes so infrequently. One would prefer larger quantities of her strange wit, thorny insight. Certainly she is one of the really original pure stylists.” – Truman Capote 
This Kickstarter is going to help fund the creation and publication of chapter one of an original graphic novel written by me, Katy Rex, about Jane’s life. This book will be published as a standalone issue and follow Jane’s life from childhood up until a freak accident on a horse that led her to be diagnosed with tuberculosis of the knee. It includes art from Tyler Jenkins (Peter Panzerfaust, Neverboy) on the main biography, and June Vigants on the short story, in full color with a stunning and evocative palette from Kelly Fitzpatrick (Sensation Comics). Editor Kirsten Thompson contributes a unique perspective on history and feminism. It will also include Jane’s short story, A Stick Of Green Candy, about the nature of love and childhood innocence and the death of imagination. An inset medical diagram art piece from artist Kate Lacour will detail the intricacies of joint tuberculosis. This campaign will allow the project to continue and build into a full length book, and will be an opportunity for backers to get the exclusive rewards that will not be available once the book is fully produced. This single extra thick issue, coming in at a full 28 printed pages, will also feature an essay from Lauren Spohrer, editor of the online magazine Two Serious Ladies, which publishes original poetry and prose from women around the world.
tuberculosis of the knee as rendered by artist Kate Lacour
This original graphic novel will follow Jane Bowles' life in ten chapters. In each chapter, there is an adaptation of one of her short stories, and each short story is adapted by a different artist. The artistic team adapting short stories includes art from Dom Sole, Betsy Peterschmidt (Boys with Wings), Ines Estrada (Ojitos Borrosos, Lapsos), June Vigants (Chainmail Bikini, Tales of the Night Watchman), Joshua Hixson (The Rebel Gun), Anne Maxson, Beatrice Penco Sechi (Lady Doll), Ryan Kelly (Lucifer, Local), Adam Gorham (Zero, Kill Shakespeare), and Sean Von Gorman (Toe Tag Riot, Pawn Shop), with a Kickstarter-exclusive cover by Marguerite Sauvage (Thor, Ninjak, The Wicked + The Divine). In order to tie together her life and stories, colorist Kelly Fitzpatrick (Sensation Comics) is creating a unifying palette and letterer/designer Taylor Esposito (Ghost Glyph Studios) will be facilitating the flow of the work.
backer reward: Strange Wit flask, art not final
Very few accounts of Jane’s life exist in the realm of public consumption. Some things are broadly and culturally agreed upon: She had many sexual relationships with women, she wrote sparsely and strangely but with genius and style, and when she met her husband, she said to a friend, “He is my enemy.” But the cultural mythos about Mrs. Bowles does very little to capture the very real and very unique person behind her strange persona.
Chapter one is completely scripted and the art is nearly complete. Help us get it printed, and YOU (yes, you!) can be eligible for a number of exciting rewards, including: 
• Digital and physical copies before they’re available anywhere else 
• Set of 10 Postcards limited edition/numbered 
• An exclusive limited edition (numbered) print of Marguerite Sauvage’s portrait of Jane 
• Thank-you letter, handwritten 
• Thank-you letter, handwritten while drunk 
• A mini-comic written & (poorly) drawn by Katy: cocktail recipes of the artistic elite 
• Options for original art from the creative team, including pages from the book and full color commissions
One of the cool things about working with a creative team of this scale is that we are able to collect work from each one of the short story artists in a unique set of 10 postcards. Each postcard comes from a place where Jane lived and worked at the time of the chapter in which that artist's short story is featured.
Title page by artist Tyler Jenkins
Since the chapter is nearly done, rewards will be printed and shipped within a few months after the campaign ends. The money made in this Kickstarter, first and foremost, will be going toward fair page rates for the excellent and high-quality work from this diverse and unique creative team. With the full length graphic novel coming in at around 240 pages, it's not a small budget, and starting to fund it through Kickstarter brings it one step closer to being a reality. While this campaign primarily funds the production and printing of chapter one, if we surpass our goal we will be able to use the additional money to speed up the production of the final book.
Sample page from A Quarreling Pair artist Joshua Hixson
This book is fun to read, beautiful to look at, and covers a crucial topic in the marginalized history of LGBT artists. Thank you for considering pledging!
UPDATE: After our awesome Comicosity interview, we decided it was probably a good idea to clarify some of our financial goals.
This Kickstarter is to print Chapter One of the book, and also to fund the artists' costs for the rest of the book. All backers WILL be getting a discount code for the finished graphic novel, but since that is still in the tentative future and being worked out logistically, it's not being formally included in this project. We know that $12,000 is steep for a single issue, and we're happy that so many of you are being so understanding about the rest of the creative team's needs, even though their work isn't being included in this issue. To make up for that, we're trying to pack as much unique and exclusive content into this mega-issue, including an essay and some concept sketches that will never make it into the final book and will only be available here on Kickstarter.

campaign.story:
Blast Furnace is an improvisational comic written and drawn an hour per page with zero planning and no idea where the story is going to go. Behold, a full color collection spanning all 280 pages of stream o' consciousness lunacy!
WE HIT OUR GOAL BUT DON'T STOP NOW! I GOTS ME SOME O' DEM STRETCH GOALS PLANNED TO MAKE IT GREAT!
STRETCH GOAL ONE (UNLocked): $20,000
If we hit $20K, everyone that bought Blast Furnace is getting a PDF download of the book to enjoy on their IPORD or Zune or Crapple Watch--whatever! Then you can seal away your physical copy in a special time capsule so it can be enjoyed by our future conquers! SUCCESS!
STRETCH GOAL TWO (UNLocked): $23,000 
$23K? Hell yeah! How about a signed and numbered mini Blast Furnace print with every book? That's right, you getting a fancy little illustration to display proudly in a tiny frame! 
STRETCH GOAL THREE (UNLocked): $25,000Y'alls getting a Blast Furnace sticker! Stick it anywhere for varied results/fines from local law enforcement! You've been warned/encouraged!
STRETCH GOAL FOUR (UNLocked): $27,000
The cover is getting a super fancy, spot-gloss upgrade! Y'know those fancy covers where you tilt them just right and see a bunch of clear shiny spots on 'em? Well, if we hit 30K you are going to seem them on Blast Furnace! Dems fancy, huh!?
STRETCH GOAL FIVE (UNLocked): $30,000
Aw yeah! Everyone who backed Blast Furnace will get a new, 80 page, digital Ryan Browne sketchbook PDF! It contains unpublished drawings and commissions that I have done of the last year. Get ready for jokes and drawings of characters that I don't own the rights to! YES!
STRETCH GOAL SIX (UNLocked): $33,000
Hell naw! You guys really pushed the envelope, and for that, anyone who bought the actual book will get an exclusive, french fold, Blast Furnace poster! That's right, french fold cause I'm fancy (it just means it's folded in half twice so that it fits nicely inside the book)! Yeah boyie!
Check out this sweet ass cover!
Mock-up of the final 6''x9'' 280 page book! Gonna be epic!
Hi, this is Ryan Browne, writer artist of the highly questionable comic, God Hates Astronauts (published first on Kickstarter, then by Image Comics). Off and on over the years, I have been producing Blast Furnace: Recreational Thief as a quick and silly improvisational comic book exercise, and now that it's an almost finished 280 page story, I need your help to print it. 
Say hello to Mr. Furnace!
Blast Furnace is about a recreational thief named Ernest Furnace who steals just about anything in the name of fun and not for financial gain. BUT his story is constantly derailed by flashbacks, dream sequences, and side stories of owls on the run from the law, hideously deformed men who look just like a horse, lil' Draculas, and electricity shooting handlebar mustaches. It's totally bat $#!t crazy and a ton of nonsensical fun! 
If you liked God Hates Astronauts, yet wish it featured more light-hearted thievery, then you will LOVE Blast Furnace!
Blast Furnace has been a free webcomic since 2012. I've started updating the online version with fancy, full color pages which you can read by clicking this link!
READ THE FIRST TWO CHAPTERS OF BLAST FURNACE HERE!
In 2012, I Kickstartered the first six black and white issues of Blast Furnace into a small graphic novel. This new collection features all 12 issues of Blast Furnace (six old, six new) now presented in 280 pages of shockingly amazing full color.
Check out the old crappy version on the left, and the new super awesome full color version on the right!
Here are some random pages full of goofs and gags. This thing is 280 pages so this is just the tip of the iceberg of hilarity!
With Blast Furnace, I wanted it to have a true improv feeling to the story. A collection of WTF moments all drawn together with a certain understandable logic. In order to do this, I have a certain set of rules I must follow…
1. NO PLANNING OR WRITING AHEAD: When I start a page, I have no idea what's going to happen on the next page and so on and so forth. I force myself to live within the page when I work on it and not look ahead to the next 10 or something.
2. SPEND NO MORE THAN ONE HOUR ON EACH PAGE (not including the colors which I do later): That's right. I start with a blank page and no real idea what's going to happen, and then, an hour later, I have a fully written, penciled, and inked page of comicbookness.
3. LET IT GO WHEREVER I FEEL LIKE: Blast Furnace is 280 pages. Knowing that ahead of time, I realized I was going to have a whole lot going on in this book. So anytime it interested me to divert from the story, via flashback, dream sequence, or even flash forwards, I did it. The end result is very wacky and stream of consciousness--but I swear it all kind of makes sense. Sort of.
AND PLEASE ENJOY SOME MORE RANDOM PAGES FROM BLAST FURNACE, WON'T YOU?
So that's Blast Furnace. It's a comic that celebrates jokes, possibly offensive jokes, nonsense jokes, and flaming tie jokes. Nothing is overly crafted and nothing takes itself too seriously. Unlike God Hates Astronauts which is heavily planned and revised, Blast Furnace is my brain presented without a filter. If you like vengeful owls, flaming tie wearing master thieves, and hideously deformed men who look just like a horse; then you are in the right place.
There are so many pages in this book! It's just about done... here's a shot of 120 of the 280 (that's all I could fit on one screen!)
CHECK OUT DEM REWARDS, Y'ALLS! On top of pre-ordering the 280 page book, I've got a bunch of other fancy reward levels on the right side, so check 'em out! Also, I've got some sweet stretch goals planned, so let's get this mother funded! Your money will be going directly towards printing the book, paying my color assistant, and paying for the shipping and materials. 
UPDATE! If you want to add a shirt to your backer level, simply add $25 for US orders, $30 for Canadian, and $35 for all other countries. At the end, you will fill out your survey and it will ask if you added money for a shirt. It'll work smoothly, don't worry. WOOT!
This super cool American Apparel shirt can be yours--if you dare!
Simon, my wonderful cat, once graced the cover of God Hates Astronauts. NOW you can have a signed 4x6 Kickstarter exclusive photo of him to adore/scare people with!
Here is a work in progress of the Blast Furnace 4'' figure by ManOrMonster Studios! Hand cast and painted, the final one will come carded in a blister pack. So fancy!
Ultimate God Hates Astronauts Combo Pack! The Hardcover, plus every issue, plus Blast Furnace!
The original art for the T-Shirt can be bought with monies!
Original art pages from the book!
The original 11x17 cover drawing can be yours? Hell's yeah, it can!
Unlike some Kickstarters, Blast Furnace: Recreational Thief will be finished and ready to go off to the printers at the end of this campaign. That's right, a 280 page print file will be ready to go as soon as I get the funding for the book. I have successfully produced both the first black and white Blast Furnace and the God Hates Astronauts hardcover through Kickstarter and fulfilled all orders within three months of the Kickstarter's conclusion. Basically, what I'm trying to say here is that I've put in the work and I've got my $#!t together. When, and if, this project gets funded, you are getting your book. It's only fair that I reward your pledge with an actual project ;)
Oh, and if you were lucky enough to back the first Blast Furnace book, I thank you so much for making the book happen back then and hope you don't mind having to buy the first six issues again--now with a huge color upgrade!
Here's a wonderful segment from chapter 9 (That's right. This book is long as hell! What value!). Enjoy?
Wasn't that fun!? Hope ole' Pornupiss is okay!
I've worked on books for Image Comics like Manhattan Projects, Bedlam, and a ten issue run of new God Hates Astronauts for the last few years, but now it's time for me to go back to the amazingness of direct funding through wonderful people like you. Kickstarter gives the greatest possible opportunity for me to produce exactly what I want artistically and it's all because of preorders from sweet dudes and dudettes like you!
YOU ROCK!
Love n' comics,
Ryan!
What's that? You haven't seen enough? FINE! Check out some more pages in no particular order from Blast Furnace. This thing is freaking 280 pages long! SO MUCH BOOK!
