We need your help getting our free comics into shops all across the country on Free Comic Book Day this year!
 Hi my name is Jeff McComsey and I am editor in chief of the World War II zombie anthology: FUBAR. We’re teaming up with fellow Independent publisher 215 ink to bring you free comics via the brand new indie comic distributor:  Liber. 
Free comic book day is an annual event, held on the first Saturday in May where just about every major comic book company distributes a few titles for free to comic shops all across the country. The idea is to bring in new fans and get old fans back in on what ends up being one of the busiest days of the year for comic shops.
It’s just about nigh impossible for indie guys like ourselves to participate in this nationwide event but with your help we think we’ve got a shot.
We’ve devised a way to double up our books so that once printed they can be cut down and one book becomes 2 mini comics chock full of Indie pulp fiction.
From FUBAR press.
FUBAR: The Devil’s Dance Floor.
Cover by: Steve Becker   Story and art by: Jeff McComsey
The Devil’s Dance floor is a 28-page stand alone World War II story about the remnants of the British 6th Army in North Africa’s last stand against zombie Erwin Rommel’s Undead Afrika Korp. Down to the very last bullets, bombs and bayonets these battle hardened Brits are out to prove that he who dares, Wins.
From 215 ink
 We have 2 shorts in one awesome book. 215’s book will be a flip style book.
Side1
Vic Boone: Sea of Trouble
Cover by: Jim McMunn Story by: Shawn Aldridge Art by:Jason Copland
 This 12 page short follows Future Portland’s notorious ex motorcycle daredevil turned private eye as he takes a vacation from the non stop robot ass beatings, femme fatale double crosses and cigarette smoking to relax at the shore… where he is immediately attacked and double crossed.
For Side 2:
Apes With Uzis: The Package
Cover by: Jeff McComsey Written by Mark Bertolini Art by Peebo Mondia
Created by Rolf Ledejgard
This 12 page short introduces Milford "Ecus" Lang as the premier black market delivery-monkey in the Primate Nation. After getting handpicked to deliver a mysterious package, Ecus then lands the job offer of a lifetime...is he monkey enough to take it?
PLUS! We have a bonus 6 page story from the upcoming GCD!
GCD: Enharmonic Showdown.
Story: Adam Wilson Art: Jolene House
This 6 page short finds two guitarists squaring off in an epic duel the likes none have ever seen.  Because when music is one of the driving forces in the universe, a simple solo can be far more deadly than anyone might imagine.
Goal:
Our goal of $1,200 gets both 215 and FUBAR 1000 mini comics and covers shipping rewards and shipping packages to comic shops for the event. Any amount we receive over this goes toward getting more books to more shops.
Retailers:
If you're a retailer that wants to receive the LIBER FCBD bundle for FREE just contact Liber to set up an account prior to April 5th.
Contact: info@liberdistro.com
REWARDS: A closer look at some of our rewards:
T-SHIRT REWARD: You're choice of either the FUBAR shirt or VIC BOONE shirt plus other goodies. Available in all men AND women sizes.
FUBAR PRINT REWARD:
Both limited edition 17"x11" prints come signed by artist, STEVE BECKER
ORIGINAL ART REWARDS:
We’re all teaming up on this project for the sole purpose of getting our comics in the hands of our fans when they show up at their shops on Free Comic Book Day.
The books are ready to go , all we need is a little help paying for printing. This is what brings us to Kickstarter.
I can speak for everyone from, FUBAR PRESS, 215 INK and Liber Distro when I say thank you for reading this far down and thank you for your time!

Dr. Dinosaur is not happy. Read the New Post detailing all new, saurian centric  campaign rewards and objectives like the SCOTT WEGENER SKETCH REWARD!!
Do your part for Science! Atomic Robo: Last Stop is an independent animated short based on the popular indie comic Atomic Robo, created by Brian Clevinger and Scott Wegener. The Fictory has logged hundreds of hours in pursuit of finishing this project. We’re close, but we can’t finish this project with out YOU!Our modest goal is to reach $12,000. Not a lot by animation budget standards but it’s just enough for us to wrangle in the last batch of work needed to complete the project.
WATCH THE TRAILER
The Fictory is an independent animation studio comprised entirely of life long story tellers, artist and other miscreants. Over the years our group has created all sorts of entertainment content specializing in independent  comics, games, film and animation. Atomic Robo: Last Stop is our most ambitious project yet.
I ran into Scott Wegener at a comic book convention right as The Fictory was in search of a new animation project to take on. Robo seemed a natural fit for animation and after we worked  out the details production got under way.
Soon after production began at The Fictory. Late August of 2010 the Atomic Robo: Last Stop Teaser Trailer was released. The studio was energized and ready to charge forward. Unfortunately/fortunately for the Staff our creative endeavors were beginning to get noticed. Before long we found ourselves busier and busier. Up to this point our schedules allowed us to band together one day a week and volunteer our skills for the good of the  project.
As time marched on, we found ourselves buried in work and unable to devote the time Atomic Robo needed and deserved. Neglected, Robo faded quietly into the background biding his time.
Until now.
We’ve sunk countless hours into this project already. Recently we’ve developed a new found urgency and sense of responsibility to complete and share the animation with the Atomic Robo community.
So we acted on our collective gut, dug in and finished some new shots for an all new Trailer! We’re locked and loaded, we just need a little help from the community to bring Robo to the screen. That’s where you come in.
ATOMIC ROBO: Last Stop facebook page: Lots of production art and general project info.
ATOMIC ROBO: Last Stop animation blog: Even more production art and animation info.
Here’s closer look at some of our pledge awards!THE OFFICIAL ATOMIC ROBO PRINT
Nab the official print of Atomic Robo: Last Stop. Illustrated by Atomic Robo co-creator, Scott Wegener! This print comes with all pledges over $25.PINS
Show your support by poking holes in your stuff. These sleek pins will look cool on your gear and really bring out your eyes.PAPER DOLLS
Feeling crafty? We’ll send you Paper versions of Robo and his co-starring action scientists! Frame ‘em flat or get some scissors and glue to assemble them in three full dimensions.



DVD - WITH SPECIAL FEATURES
Atomic Robo DVD. The final dvd will include the animated short and a ton of extra behind the scenes process stuff as well as interviews with crew.


OFFICIAL T-SHIRT
Atomic Robo: Last stop official T-shirt. Available in all sizes for men and women.

ART BOOK
Over 100 pages of process, backgrounds and funder-exclusive art.  ...and tons of little extras that Atomic Robo fans will love and appreciate!
ANIMATION CELL
Just about every frame of Atomic Robo: Last Stop is hand drawn by one of The Fictory’s resident Killustrators. On real paper! Here’s your chance to own one of those hand drawn frames.


SIGNED ATOMIC ROBO VOLUMES
Pick up any Atomic Robo volumes of your choice or collect them all! All Atomic Robo volumes come signed by series creators, Brian Clevinger and Scott Wegener!
UPDATE ON $250 REWARDS AND OVER.
Any backer who pledged for the $250 reward and over will receive SIX volumes of Atomic Robo signed by series creators, not FIVE as is indicated in those rewards!

STORYBOARDS
After the screenplay has been approved. Storyboards represent the very first stage in the life of an animation. Own your very own piece of the Atomic Robo production by pledging for these one of a kind storyboards.

SELF PORTRAIT WITH ATOMIC ROBO
Portrait with Robo. You get the idea.

SCOTT WEGENER ORIGINAL ART
Series co creator Scott Wegener, is a master line-slinger. Here’s your chance to own a one of a kind piece of original art signed by Scott!

GET ANIMATED
Here’s your chance to not only help fund the animated short but to appear in it! We have two scenes that are yet to be finished where we have need of a few extras. You have the chance to be an extra on a commuter train OR a chance to be forever immortalized as an Action Scientist! This is a limited reward and my personal favorite.

SPEAKING ENGAGEMENTS AND WORKSHOPS
Here are two reward types that we’ve geared towards educators.

Speaking Engagement Reward
As well as being founder of The Fictory I am also an adjunct professor at Pennsylvania College of Art and Design where I’m very comfortable with the classroom setting. For this pledge reward I’m available to come in to any animation/art department and talk about what goes into producing Independent animations. Main topics include running a staff of talented artists and designers with a heavy emphasis on how one goes from a student to a professional in a constantly evolving job market. Any questions on specifics and logistics, send them to info@thefictory.comIndependent  Animation Crash Course Reward
In addition to the offering speaking engagements I am also available for workshops style engagements. The idea is to offer curriculums a crash course in how The Fictory executes a project. At The Fictory one of our biggest axioms is doing more with less.
In other words, how to organize a small group of dedicated artists into a studio capable of producing quality animation to rival a studio twice its size. To that end there will be a heavy emphasis on getting the most out of a small team of artists. This workshop would put students together to produce a small animated project. Instead of the individual producing a short piece alone the emphasis is on distribution of talent, working out group dynamics and pooling creative resources to accomplish goals. For specifics and logistics, send inquiries to info@thefictory.com

campaign.story:
DC-based singer-songwriter René Moffatt wrote and recorded a catchy little tune about DC's beloved "42 bus" and now wants to shoot a sweet music video to immortalize that time-honored tradition of WAITING ... for the bus!
The script is finished, the team is assembled, calendar dates are on hold but René needs your help to make it happen!
To the right you'll find a slew of incentives (in the form of pledge levels) that will surely entice you to embrace your inner-Medici and "back" this project! Whether you're a local and just looking to receive "Good Bus Karma" ($2) or you are a local business who feels like being the "Official Sponsor" ($500)... there's a pledge level for all patrons.
Funds will be used to create t-shirts, stickers, build a website, pay the director and crew, as well as throw a benefit concert for a local charity!
Thank you in advance for your time, consideration, inspiration, and (hopefully) patronage!

campaign.story:
If we get to $100,000, we can do everything on this list and MORE! CLICK HERE TO SEE
If we get to $200,000 this is an idea I had... CLICK!
We now have a Backer Only Tumblr with exclusive previews on work for Womanthology! Check the private Backer only update for link and password!
Quick notes: You cannot make multiple pledges. If you wish to pledge for a few things, add those amounts to your pledges and notify me what they are!
The rewards include shipping, but we *humbly request* if you live outside the US to add $5 to help with the added cost! Thank you so much!
All pledges from the $15 sketchbook and beyond will get their name in black text in the book (unless noted otherwise in a specific reward)
What is Womanthology & what makes it so special?
Womanthology is a large scale anthology comic showcasing the works of women in comics. It is created entirely by over 140 women of all experience levels, including top industry professionals such as:
Barbara Kesel (Writer/Editor Marvel, DC, Crossgen, Image, Dark Horse)
Gail Simone ( DC writer, Wonder Woman, Birds of Prey, Secret Six)
Annie Nocenti ( Marvel writer, Dardevil, Editor for Uncanny X-Men, New Mutants)
Ming Doyle ( Boom, Image, Marvel artist)
Devin Grayson (DC writer; Batman, Nightwing, New Titans)
Lauren Montgomery (Director & Storyboard Artist - Justice League, DC)
Fiona Staples (DC, Wildstorm, IDW , Vertigo artist)
June Brigman  (Creator; Brenda Starr, Power Pack)
Samantha Newark (Voice of JEM, Singer/Vocals - God of War, Hook)
Bonnie Burton( Grrl.com)
Many, many more! See Full List of Contributors HERE
Click the pic to check out some amazing artwork from our contributors!
The purpose of the book is to show support for female creators in comics and media. There will be multiple short stories, "how to"s & interviews with professionals, and features showcasing iconic female comic creators that have passed, such as Nell Brinkley and Tarpe Mills. A Kids & Teens section will also be included, showcasing their work, and offering tips & tricks to help them prepare themselves for their future careers in comics. Overall, this is pretty much a huge book showcasing what women in comics have accomplished, and what we are capable of :) We are also hoping that by doing this book, it will encourage a new generation of women to pick up the pencil and create!
Part of what's special about Womanthology is its equal opportunity aspects. Big- name professionals like Gail Simone are paired up with new and upcoming talent to promote opportunity and chances for those newcomers to learn, and give them a stage to show what they can do. For instance, Gail will be paired up with extraordinary new artist Jean Kang! Or for, another example, legendary artist Camilla d'Errico will be paired up with up and coming writer Raven Moore! Check out the Womanthology site for more exciting team ups!
How do we plan to do this?
The book is currently in production. There is a tentative release date for Womanthology of December 7th, 2011, which may change. We will keep everyone updated as things develop. Please check the FAQS for notes on rewards and when they will be sent! :) Please watch for unlocked rewards that will include a special password to a place where you can preview the works from the many talents of Womanthology!
What is the money for?
The current Kickstarter goal amount would help us print a small run (1500) of books. This will be a 300 page, 9x12, hardcover, full-color book. All money earned goes directly to printing costs and other fees such as postage/production of rewards.
Our current goal is $25,000. If we, by some miracle, make OVER that goal we have some very special plans! Please see the FAQS below for more information!

Why should I pledge for this project?
Womanthology is the first of its kind. Never before have women in comics & media come together in such a huge way to create something like this. Never before has there been a publisher willing to give so many people a chance. By pledging, you are helping to create a piece of history itself, and being there to support a massive, positive movement of people into the right direction.
Thank you so much if you even considered helping! It's very much appreciated by all of us!
... You mentioned special unlocked rewards?
Well fine sir/miss, I sure did! The closer we get to our goal, and the more special rewards taken up, the more I can offer! There are more special rewards planned; please check back often so you don't miss out on some really special opportunities that I have planned ;) !
UNLOCKED REWARDS SO FAR!
CLICK TO GO TO CARGO HOLD'S AWESOME EBAY STORE!
See More of Fred Jeska's work HERE
CLICK TO SEE MORE FIGURE PICTURES!
SEE CLOSE UP OF ALL KEYS HERE
CLICK FOR CLOSER VIEW OF LIMITED EDITION HERCULES KEY
IMPORTANT NOTES
- The animated sequences in the video were part of an animated music video for "Into the Woods" by singer Cilla Jane, with animation by the incredible Adam Phillips. Into the Woods is about a girl's journey through childhood and her experiences to becoming a woman, and triumphing in the end. I thought it was just a perfect fit for the mood and theme of Womanthology! They were kind enough to let us borrow some clips to help us with our project. So thank you Adam and Cilla! :) Please go HERE to find out how you can get the song!
- Contents and contributors of the book are subject to change as production continues
- Make sure to check out the FAQ on rewards for important additional information!

Thanks to everyone for all of your support! Feel free to message me with any questions or concerns! ;D womanthology@gmail.com

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 
This is the final mass update for Womanthology. There are so few left who are in need of their book still, that I feel it best that I update you individually from now on through email. :)
Charity...
Womanthology has been an incredible experience. When I launched it last year, half expecting failure, I had no idea the huge amount of happiness, difficulty, stress, and joy I would experience, or the sheer amount of positivity it would create. Being my first Kickstarter (one that was overly successful) I was caught unprepared by the huge amount of work required to take care of it all. That as well as my months of illness, created a few months of delays, which I wish more than anything could have been avoided. Despite that, I hope most of you are pleased with the final product, and are overall satisfied with the level of dedication I've tried  to give to this project and all it's backers. I care very much about each of you, and the mere fact that you put your hard earned money and trust onto this project creates an appreciation I will carry with me past the delivery of your book.

Hello everyone! :) How are you today? And Happy Spring to you all!
Straight to News & Updates! Scroll down for REWARDS if that is what you want to check on!
Womanthology: Space
Yep, it's true! There's to be further Womanthology! :) This one is themed Womanthology: Space. IDW late last year made it known they wanted to further extend the good of Womanthology and help support more women creatives in comics, so they have decided to pick up Womanthology for a series of 5 issues that will then be collected into a Graphic Novel!

Hello everyone! :)
Apologies for the later update! The release day for Womanthology has FINALLY arrived and there's so much preparation going on for it!
March 14th, this Wednesday, the book will be released in the direct market (comic shops). It's a really momentous occasion for all involved. It's been months and months of hard work, and now it's here! :D It's really finally time!

Hello everyone! Happy Valentine's Day!! :)

We decided put together a fun new book for you all to download for Valentine's Day!! This in thanks once again of all the support and love we've gotten from everyone of Womanthology, from both Kickstarter Backers and to everyone else who have been there along the way. So this is available for everyone!

This 30+ page special consists of current Womanthology contributors and some new ones. :) I also felt it would be fun to welcome any interested men to join in the fun this time. They've all been so supportive of Womanthology and women in comics this entire time, I felt they could further show their support with their talents for Valentines if they were so interested :)

Hello guys! :D Hope the New Year is treating all of you well!
I'm making this an update for both Backers & Public as there's info that non-Backers might like to know as well.
This update covers:
Release Date Information
Womanthology is a beast of a book that is unlike any other, so there were a lot of fun twists and turns and challenges to get it ready, and everyone involved (including the amazing team at IDW who have been tirelessly preparing it for print) have been working nonstop to make it happen, and this delay is not the cause of anyone, just an unfortunate happening. I personally just cannot wait to hold the book in my hands!! On the bright side, if it is indeed released in early March, it'll coincide with Women's History Month :) So destiny maybe?

campaign.story:
“The only thing we have to fear is fear itself… and ZOMBIES!!”   -Franklin Delano Roosevelt
 The 35 Small-Press Commandos that contributed to FUBAR: Empire of Rising Dead need your help getting this anthology to the printer!  In return for your hard earned money, we offer graphic novels, custom artwork, zombie shooting targets AND our unwavering gratitude.
Hello! My name is Jeff McComsey and I’m the editor in chief of the World War II zombie anthology called FUBAR.
This anthology chronicles a zombie outbreak right in the middle of World War II, just prior to the d-day invasion. Originally FUBAR started out as a small side project of mine and like side projects tend to do, it took on a life of its own and then took over mine.
We released our first 188 page volume last year Entitled FUBAR: European theater of the Damned. We set the 15 stories of volume one in the European theater of WWII. Classic zombie Nazi smashing fun for the whole family in that volume.
The 20 stories that comprise FUBAR volume 2: Empire of the Rising Dead all take place exclusively in the Pacific theater of World War II.  Replace zombie Nazis with Zombie Kamikazes and add in a helping of crazy zombie Jarheads and you get the idea.
Both volumes are stand alone and don't need to be read in order so choose whichever volume strikes your World War II zombie smashing fancy... OR you could get both.
FUBAR VOLUME 1 PREVIEW!
FUBAR VOLUME 2 PREVIEW!
Volume 2 clocks in at 194 pages and contains the work of over 35 writers, artists, letterers, and is 100% complete and ready to go.
The logistics are all locked in except for one important part. We're here  to ask you ladies and gents for a little help getting this second volume off to the  printer.
 If funding is successful we intend to use the money exclusively for the offset print run of FUBAR Volume 2: Empire of the rising Dead.  
 CUSTOM SKETCHES!
There's a lot of the custom art and sketching we only ever get to do at conventions and signings like: our choose your own historical/fictitious WW II character and we draw them in the front page square of your newly purchased book sketch.  We're very excited about sharing these type of pledge rewards with any supporters who purchase Volume 1 or Volume 2.
AND ZOMBIE SHOOTING TARGETS?
Below you will find links to examples of some of our pledge rewards including a gallery of Steve Becker's Zombie Combat targets that you get to choose from for those specific rewards featuring an 11x17 print. You will also find links to view some of the custom zombie sketches we do in the front pages of both Volume 1 and 2. We've also included links to the zombie portraits and the Medal of Honor portrait so you guys get a better idea of what we mean in the pledge rewards.
ZOMBIE COMBAT TARGETS
CUSTOM FRONT SKETCHES
ZOMBIE PORTRAITS
MEDAL OF HONOR PORTRAITS
SIX PANEL CINEMA
You guys are awesome...
In the comics community there's always talk about whether or not the medium's day has come and gone. Looking around at the caliber of new creators and projects In the Small-Press community alone as well as remarkable outlets like Kickstarter, We feel like there's never been a better time to make comics.
 This series contains inspired work by over three dozen writers, artists, letterers and is to date the project of which I am most proud to have been a part of.  Your support of Indie comics in general and FUBAR in particular makes it possible for these project to exist and thrive. I know I can speak for all the creators involved when I say thank you. Thanks you for your time and for your support.

my name is mc chris i'm involved with the shows you see on adult swim. i put out rap records and tour like crazy. i'm from the suburbs of Chicago I studied drawing at the School of the Institute of Chicago and screenwriting at the Tisch School at NYU. I worked at Adult Swim for five years. I've always been behind the scenes but i've never had a chance to do something of my own.

Thank you everyone for making our CD and video possible!!!
We are humbled, grateful and just amazed at the amount of support we've received. Two more songs are posted on the Update tab (a total of four now), one of them being Everything, which looks like it will be the winner for the video shoot.

Thanks again for all your help,
Michael and all of The Black Marks





Here's our original project post, if you want to get to know us a little better:
This whole project started in January, when we decided to begin working on our full-length debut album. We had recorded songs a year earlier, but we were still feeling our way around our sound at that time.
In January, we sat down and looked at albums that inspired us: Ziggy Stardust, London Calling, Bruce Springsteen's Nebraska. All albums worked well as a whole and carried a distinct feeling throughout their entirety. This is what we strove to do with our debut.
We made a list of all our songs, and eventually whittled it down to nine tracks that played well off each other, shared similar moods and spoke to the listener on an emotional level.
Being fairly handy people, and blessed to have talented friends, we took a DIY approach to recording. Jim Orr did the heavy lifting in his home studio; the rest of it was recorded in our homes using protools. To accomplish this, spouses often helped out with kid duties and babysitting to free up other members of the band.
As of now, we're happy to say the album is completely recorded - done on a shoestring budget without sacrificing any quality. But this is where we need your help.
We were planning on mixing ourselves, but Michael, the guitarist, called up his brother-in-law, Scott Greiner, a professional sound engineer who has worked with Liz Phair and most recently, The Posies. With a nice brother-in-law discount, Scott agreed to produce and mix our album.
At the same time, Michael's work offered to shoot a professional music video for the band while only charging for basic costs, food and some beverages. This is what adds up to our $2,000 goal - helping to cover some of Scott's costs, mastering, CD production and shooting the video.
Any donation you can make to our cause is greatly appreciated. We're offering some great gifts for those kind people who donate, and we've tried to keep our main offerings at the $25 and below line, as we all understand how tight extra funds can be. And if by the grace of good fortune we exceed our $2,000 goal by double, we'll be able to do something extra cool - numbered vinyl records to all who donated $15 or more!
Thanks for checking out our pitch and visiting kickstarter.
Sincerely,
The Black Marks

You all made this possible, and now that the video is done, we'll be making the DVDs and printing the artwork. Every time I list a deadline, it gets pushed way back, but I'm optimistic that I won't lie this time and you'll all get the things you donated for this June.

Chris Beutler - Director

Brian Stetson - Post-production

Hi Everyone,
Sorry it's been so long for an update, but I finally have something to update you all with. We have wrapped up shooting the video. Now, we're in serious edit mode. I thought we'd be done shooting in September, but it took so long as we had multiple people (about 14 total) donating their time and skills to getting this thing filmed correctly. Everyone has full-time jobs, so scheduling was difficult, as was finding the right locations and recovering from a few close calls (like when the security guard pulled a gun on a carload of us when we were filming with a Go Pro in a parking garage!).

Thank you so much for your generosity and making our CD and DVD possible! As soon as kickstarter ends, we'll be collecting emails and sending you a link to download the CD - should be June 11.

Hello! We're Vantage Point Productions, the crew behind Season 2 of Penny Arcade: The Series.
After the huge fan response to the PA:TS episode featuring Scott Kurtz and Kris Straub ("The Takeover"), we thought it unfair to the universe not to create a web series featuring the comedic stylings of this dynamic duo. We approached Scott and Kris and we all agreed that this should happen.  However, after emptying our pockets on the table we realized that it would be difficult to produce the show on a handful of lint-covered Runts, two nickels, and a rupee (?).  So, in need of capital to make this show a reality, we humbly come to you.
What, you ask, would a Scott and Kris show entail? We're looking to produce a ten-episode series (like the pilot episode above) in addition to a three-disc DVD featuring outtakes and behind-the-scenes material. When we reach our goal, the show will air on PATV starting Summer 2011.
The budget from Kickstarter will go solely towards the cost of production: cameras, microphones, editing, travel, soundtrack music, audio mixing, DVD authoring and duplication, Kickstarter and Amazon fees, and so on.
By backing this project, not only will you be helping us produce the show, you'll have access to unique and exclusive rewards including signed copies of the DVD, your name in the show credits, original art and books from Scott and Kris, extra footage of the production and much more.
We're excited about this project because we get to work with Scott and Kris. You might be excited about this project because you get to see Scott and Kris. Most importantly, Kris is excited about this project because he believes it's one step closer to reuniting with his estranged father. Scott's just always "excited."
So let's make it happen.
Help spread the word: http://www.tinyurl.com/scottkristv
Thank you so much for your support!
- Vantage Point Productions

campaign.story:
UPDATE #4:
Help us get to $40,000! We have four days to go and we want to get to $40k. We are using our fourth update to promote this new goal. In honor of the number four, we're adding a prize at $400 - a limited-edition Safecast t-shirt.
UPDATE #3:
Thank you, everyone, for helping us reach our goal! Any additional funds raised will help us purchase more Geiger counters to send to Japan.
We also wanted to clarify for our top donors. Anyone donating $1,000 will receive a Geiger counter. In addition to that, the Top 10 donors will also receive an iGeigie. So that would be two devices for the top 10.
UPDATE #2:
Our thank you cards will come in the shape of Field Notes books. See more here: 
Field Notes book as a Thank You card
UPDATE:
We've rebranded RDTN as Safecast. Here's an in-depth explanation behind the name change:
http://blog.rdtn.org/2011/04/24/rdtn-is-now-safecast/
And for some information about how the funding will be applied, see this post:
http://blog.safecast.org/2011/04/24/first-safecast/
About:
Safecast.org (formerly RDTN.org) is a website whose purpose is to provide an aggregate feed of nuclear radiation data from governmental, non-governmental and citizen-scientist sources. That data will be made available to everyone, including scientists and nuclear experts who can provide context for lay people. In the weeks following launch, it has become evident that there is a need for additional radiation reporting from the ground in Japan. This Kickstarter project will help us purchase up to 600 Geiger Counter devices that will be deployed to Japan. (The project minimum will fund about 100 devices). The data captured from these devices will feed into our website and will also be made available for others to use via Pachube, an open-source platform for monitoring sensor data globally. Our field members will be trained by ouradvisors to properly use these devices. The field members will be required to report to the website 8-10 times per day.
Open-Source Underpinnings:
We will make the raw data available from our network for anyone to use under Creative Commons 0 dedication. It is our goal that providing this data to non-profit organizations, governments and scientists will keep people and societies more informed in the current crisis as well as future incidents where data might otherwise be scarce. 
Phase 1 and Phase 2:
We want to eventually build our own network of devices. We recognize, however, that there’s an immediate need to get devices on the ground now. So our project has two phases. Phase 1 is about getting devices out to the areas with the least amount of data. Phase 2 will focus on  building a larger network of devices that will help governments, citizens and organizations understand immediate and long-term implications of radiation levels.
Where will they be deployed?
In looking at a map of radiation detection in Japan, there are many holes where no data is being captured whatsoever. Some of those are very close to Fukushima while others are well outside of Tokyo. The initial set of devices will be utilized in areas where coverage is sparse. We will deliver these devices to people on the ground who have been trained in how to use them. It could be a teacher, a university student, or a citizen scientist looking to contribute to the project.
Who will be using these devices?
We want to provide the device to someone who has an above-average understanding of technology, but not necessarily an expert. This should be someone who knows how to install an app on their iPhone or Android device, and is familiar with filling out forms on websites. No programming skills or engineering degree is required. Knowing how to set up a wifi-router is a plus.
Device List: (UPDATED)
We are currently working with a distributor of detection devices in order to get them at a discounted cost. Due to the ease of use of the CRM-100, we have decided to focus on this unit for our volunteers in Japan.
CRM-100
The CRM-100 is a general purpose geiger counter that measures alpha, beta, gamma, and x-radiation. It is intended for personal safety and educational purposes, not for professional applications. Like the popular Radalert 100, the CRM-100 features a 3-second update on its digital liquid crystal display (LCD). The LCD shows the current radiation level in your choice of milliroentgens per hour from .001 to 110 or counts per minute (cpm) from 0 to 350,000. When SI units are selected, the LCD shows readings in microsieverts per hour from .01 to 1100 or counts per second (cps) from 0 to 3,500. This instrument also offers an accumulated total and timer function, up to 9,999,000 counts and 40 hours. A red LED blinks and a beeper chirps with each count (the chirp can be muted).

campaign.story:
Here you are, in a waiting room, writing down your name in a time slot, preparing yourself to expect the unexpected. Someone calls your name; this person is dressed as a businessman with the face of a pig. He leads you into a room where you have to crawl through a tunnel. As you enter the next room, you are met by wise creatures who tell you stories and give you gifts to aid you on the journey you are about to embark on. You eventually find yourself faced with strange challenges where you must answer riddles and appear on weirdo talk shows to discover that without you and your decisions, this world would not exist. In this journey, YOU become the hero, YOU are the main character.
The Rooms Play is a collaborative, immersive theatrical experience that asks the viewer to become a participant in the performance. There are twenty- two rooms to walk through, and each one is directed by a different team of 2-5 local artists and musicians. Each space in The Rooms Play functions like a scene of a play, and the audience members are integral to the scene’s unfolding.
The narrative bases for the first rooms play (the video shown above) were Joseph Campbell’s Mono-myth and the digestive system. The mono-myth refers to a basic pattern found in stories around the world; it is the skeletal story arc of a hero’s journey. Combining these two “storylines” we crafted a unique written proposal, which defines both the conceptual basis for the play and the architectural structure corresponding to each room. This was then presented to at least 60 different artists in Baltimore, of which over 40 participated. What resulted was an immensely collaborative, vividly transformative experience for those involved and those who participated (the audience).
A huge aspect of this project is to create a form of art where artists can empower one another through collaboration, recognizing their importance and voice as culture-makers. The basis of our conversation is the artists proposal, which incorporated social issues such as immigration and racism as the foundation of the story that the artists will follow. With over 20 artists already on board, regular bi-weekly meetings and conversations with the artists through the entire process will be extending the conversation of immigration outside of the play itself.
For this year’s Rooms Play immigration will act as our inspiration for movement. We are encouraging artistic meditation on what it means to be faced with the challenges of legal, ill legal, alien(nation) and othering. This year, the play will focus more specifically on issues of power, control, and choice. The theme of freedom and its guises are being explored through a re-writing of the heroes journey to reflect contemporary uses of power and control.
How this takes place?
Rooms Play is going to be a part of the 8th annual Transmodern Arts Festival here in Baltimore, Maryland. You can explore the website if you go here: http://www.transmodernfestival.org
Each of the 20 rooms will be constructed in a large warehouse space. The rooms are mostly made of lumber and fabric, with individual installations determining the exact configuration and size of the spaces. The installation and performances in each room are created by a different team of artists, who serve as the creative directors for that room. The installations are created with all sorts of things - lightbulbs, plastic paper bags, huge sheets of colored paper, plants, paint, loft spaces, you name it - the materials needed for the construction of an environment and costumes vary with each participant artist's imagination. We think BIG.
This is where the budget comes in!
It is important for us to pay the artists involved, we want the artists to be able to do what is important to them while also being able to afford their rent. We also need to buy the materials such as lumber, fabric, nails and staples! We aim to be ecologically conscious - buying and using resourced materials - while maintaining safety; thus we are buying as many of our materials as possible from local businesses that sell resourced material.
Although we are asking for $5000, the calculations call for a higher number of funds. Every little bit helps!
Budget Description
PERSONNEL: based on stipend for time and materials Room (split among artists per room) $200 x 21(rooms)= $4200 Videographer $150 Photographer $150 Poster designer $150
MATERIALS: based on average prices and approximations. These materials will construct the 20 rooms that make up rooms play as well as be shared amongst the artists to complete their installations
2”x 4’ lumber $213- 108 pieces of pine lumber studs x $1.97 Sheetrock (drywall) $267- 36 sheets of Fire shield drywall at $7.41 a sheet Hardware (screws & nails) $72 4 boxes of drywall screws at $5.94 = $24 4 boxes of wood screws at $5.94= $24 4 boxes of nails at $5.94 = $24 Staple guns $250- 10 manual staple guns at $25 Staples $140- 20boxes at $7 Plywood $200- $200 Fabric (heavy duty) $350 Hot melt guns and glue $135 6 hot glue guns at $9.99= $60 15 packs of 50 hot glue sticks at $4.99= $75 Extension cords $100 Rope $30 Tape (duct, electrical) $30 Power surge strips $50 Miscellaneous material $300
Transportation $200 To transport materials to space TOTAL AMOUNT NEEDED: $6987

campaign.story:
If you love supporting live music, if you are aware of the talent that has and continues to emerge out of the DC music scene, if you've attended any of the BandHouse Gigs tribute shows, please invest and become a backer to help BandHouse Gigs release our next tribute highlights CD.
Since 2004, BandHouse Gigs has been a labor of love by the four founders, and the local area musicians in our DC community. All involved musicians give freely of their time to rehearse and perform the music of some of the world's most cherished artists. To date our tributes have included the work of: Nils Lofgren, Joni Mitchell, Bob Dylan, Neil Young, Nick Lowe, Allen Toussaint, Warren Zevon and Neil Finn. These shows have exposed new generations to the music of these fine artists and their amazing catalog of work.
Last August, in celebration of the 40th Anniversary to Woodstock, over sixty musicians performed an inspired tribute celebrating the music performed at the historic festival (culminating in the finale of "With a Little Help From My Friends," pictured above) at Strathmore Music Center. We are asking those who have enjoyed and supported our shows to help us raise money to produce our next tribute CD, The British Invasion music from 1964-1966. By becoming a backer, you not only get a copy of our British Invasion CD, you support the hundreds of musicians who have been on our collective shows. Our CDs provide widespread exposure for new musicians on the local scene by introducing them to the world playing the tunes you know and love.
Some of the musicians who have performed on our shows include Stueart Smith (The Eagles), John Jennings (Mary Chapin Carpenter), Jon Carroll (Mary Chapin, Peter Wolf), Bill Dannoff (Starland Vocal Band), Skunk Baxter (Doobie Brothers), and national acts like Eddie From Ohio. We are so proud of the work that we do and have thus far released a DVD of the first tribute to local hero, Nils Lofgren, and CDs of our Joni Mitchell Tribute at Strathmore in Bethesda, MD and Allen Toussaint Tribute at The Barns at Wolf Trap in Vienna, VA. We are just finishing the album from last years Woodstock tribute and a DVD of our tribute to Joni Mitchell.
Thank you for your support!
Danny Schwartz BandHouse Gigs Producer.

updates.update_content: I sit in the guest room of old family friends here in San Raphel outside of San Francisco. This weekend I attend the Hardly Strictly Bluegrass Festival in Golden Gate Park. Right now there is only 22 hours remaining in our funding. Thank you all so much for your contributions and ongoing support of BandHouse Gigs and our efforts to bring our friends and great music to various stages in the DC area. Raising this amount in funding will allow for us to make a beautifully produced, mixed, and mastered double disc to recap the best of both nights at Strathmore in August. Throughout the process of producing the album, I will continue to update the project page allowing all of our backers to have an inside look at what goes into these tributes and albums. Plus bakers will get to hear a few select tracks in the rough mix stage before the release of the album. Thank you all again for your support. If you want to up your contribution or get your friends to pre-order their copies, this is the last chance. Also, backers who pre-order will receive their copies before we put them on sale to the public. Get your copy.

updates.update_content:
I spent my whole Sunday yesterday lining up the forty eight multi tracked recordings from the second night of the British Invasion. It was rather exciting. The performances were so much fun and every song got me siked to put together this record. BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP. We're in the home stretch, with less then ten days to go, we need to make a final push. To anyone who has contributed thank you and please tell you friends to simply pre-order themselves a copy of this amazing record. I have plans to make it a double disc since there's soooo much music. A double disc worth of content for only $20or opt for the digital download for only $10. No time to waste, walk up your in-laws, buy copies for all the music lovers on your holiday list, and as always go see live music.
Here for your enjoyment and contributing encouragement is huge slideshow of all the pictures Bill Bronrott took Thursday night. The slideshow accompanied by Jon Carroll performing Time On My Side and then the rounding rendition of All You Need Is Love, led by Tom Lofgren and featuring the entire cast of the show. Please dig deep into your pockets and help us get this record made. Without your support these recording may never pass this phase. Thanks.

So I'm bouncing tracks from the board mix from the British Invasion show on Wednesday night. It was a truly remarkable show and everyone involved worked so hard. Eric Brace and Last Train Home drove from Nashville the day of the show, Jon Carroll flew in from California the day before during the Mary Chapin tour, and there were many many folks who attended more then one of our nine pre-show rehearsals.
Today I am sharing a slideshow of photos from the Wednesday night production of the show taken by Linda Parker. All these pictures are available to view at www.bandhousegigs.com. To accompany the photos is our show open featuring the voice acting of Adam Moskowitz, Deborah Schwartz, David Sless, and Cal Everett. Then it seamlessly goes into the band on stage playing She Loves You. It was a great open and I'm so glad we went for it.
Lastly, we're down to 37 days before October and more then half of our goal must still be raised. Please dig deep and suggest this project and cause to your friends. Spread the good word about BandHouse Gigs and our efforts to showcase the best music DC has to offer. I'll keep working hard on my end and by the winter we'll all get a chance to relive the magic of the British Invasion Tribute. Thanks again.

campaign.story:
Hello kickstarter community!
Michelle Maxwell here and I helped produce Hardcore Hearts with Danny Herb (the guy in the video above) and we are so excited about finishing out our first feature film. Exciting! The footage and story we have stored on our hard drive is amazing and we are dying to get this puppy out of storage and finished. We need some assistance to complete the final edit, post sound work and film festival submissions. This has been a passion project from day one. Every single person working with us (cast, crew, friends, family members, etc) have been so dedicated, asking for nothing in return, but that we get this story out there. Make this little dream of ours a reality.
Well I'm sure your wondering what the story is all about that has pumped so many people about Hardcore Hearts.
In short, its about a group of twenty something adults hitting that pivotal point of their lives when you are trying to differentiate what you believe and what you have been taught to believe by your parents and community. They are going through this discovery together. The five main characters, Luke, Mark, Jayce, Corey and Sam, are in a hardcore music band together called Hand of Blood. I was particularly interested in the project because there are not many movies out there depicting the hardcore rock scene and as a lover of the style for many years I wouldn't dare pass up the opportunity to blend my two loves, movies and music. I digress. The plot touches on relationships, religion, homosexuality, acceptance and figuring out how to make sense of this crazy world we live in. The film is ultimately about love and figuring out where your belief lies for yourself.
Phenomenal acting, inspiring music and a genuine story all make Hardcore Hearts a film I am proud to stand behind. I'm hoping it is also a film you will join me in standing behind.
Check out more footage put together by our talented Danny in trailer form at: http://www.youtube.com/watch...
and check out our website at: www.hardcorehearts.com
We have a fantastic editor and sound designer lined up to help us out and our sights set on submitting to some of the top film festivals in the country. I hope to meet everyone who has contributed along the way!
